channel.title: The Secret To Success with CJ, Karl, Jemal & Eric Thomas
channel.description: From homeless, high school drop out to Entrepreneur, C.E.O. and Ph.D.! Hear first hand how Eric was able to defy the odds, and single-handedly break the negative generational cycles that plagued his family for decades. Join the conversation with ET and co-host Carlas Quinney Jr. and learn how you too can create the life you deserve.

item.title: 357 - Ya' Mon!
item.description:
In this “live from Jamaica” episode, the guys discuss how vital it is to be exposed to life-changing information and environments, staying focused on the goal, the importance of persistence in your pursuit of excellence.
13:09 - What are you investing for? Is it to be a burden or blessing to somebody?
14:45 - “Exposure can change the way you view money.” Is your source of information contributing to or stunting your growth?
16:12 - “The best way to prove it is to prove it.” Few people will believe in your story or journey, especially if you’re the first in your family to do so.
20:04 - “Your level of exposure will determine your level of success.”
23:51 - “Information without the desire to use it is a recipe for failure.”
30:03 - “When you believe as a leader, that focus can be transferred to your team.”
Questions
What culture are you trying to create?
What’s yours? Why?
What area of your life needs a faith muscle?
Takeaways
If people don’t think your dream is crazy, your dream isn’t big enough.
Show support towards one another. It’s better to say “I don’t understand” versus saying negative remarks that can tear someone down.
Reflect on the decisions made by others for opportunities in your life.
﻿Listener Perks
Organifi Is giving our listeners up to 20% off of their order! Just go to www.organifi.com/success. Support your journey from sunrise to sunset with fan-favorite superfoods backed by science to replenish micronutrients, support energy and balance hormones from am to pm with our customer favorites.
MASTERWORKS is the premium stock market for exclusive art across the world. If you're looking for alternative assets to gain wealth in a high inflation environment, look no further. Head over to Masterworks.art/success to have priority access to offerings before anyone else has a chance to obtain. Take advantage of this great opportunity with the demand being very high.
Head over to Etbulk.com to purchase copies of the New York Best Selling Book You Owe You.

In this “live from Jamaica” episode, the guys discuss how vital it is to be exposed to life-changing information and environments, staying focused on the goal, the importance of persistence in your pursuit of excellence. 



13:09 - What are you investing for? Is it to be a burden or blessing to somebody?


14:45 - “Exposure can change the way you view money.” Is your source of information contributing to or stunting your growth? 


16:12 - “The best way to prove it is to prove it.” Few people will believe in your story or journey, especially if you’re the first in your family to do so. 



20:04 - “Your level of exposure will determine your level of success.”


23:51 - “Information without the desire to use it is a recipe for failure.”



30:03 - “When you believe as a leader, that focus can be transferred to your team.”




Questions 


What culture are you trying to create?


What’s yours? Why?


What area of your life needs a faith muscle?



Takeaways


  • If people don’t think your dream is crazy, your dream isn’t big enough. 


  • Show support towards one another. It’s better to say “I don’t understand” versus saying negative remarks that can tear someone down. 


  • Reflect on the decisions made by others for opportunities in your life.

item.title: 356 - Just Hold Me
item.description:
In this episode, the guys continue speaking on how to maneuver through cultural norms, along with providing the formula for obtaining success in your life.
18:20 - Learn your craft to the fullest. Faking your status stagnates your actual growth.
26:10 - What cultural norms are stopping you from growing?
35:21 - CJ explains how giving up what you want in the short term is vital for long-term success.
40:05 - Are you allowing comfort to inhibit your growth?
Takeaways
Get rid of the Imposter syndrome.
Have the heart to break free from bad habits and walk in greatness.
Immerse yourself in the community, learn everything you can and put that effort to work.
Don't worry about what others think.
Find ways to keep your hunger & drive for success active. Never deviate from the path that made you successful.
Enjoy the fruits of your labor.
Questions
What are you indulging in that prohibits your success?
Listener Perks
Organifi Is giving our listeners up to 20% off of their order! Just go to www.organifi.com/success. Support your journey from sunrise to sunset with fan-favorite superfoods backed by science to replenish micronutrients, support energy and balance hormones from am to pm with our customer favorites.
Policy Genius If someone relies on your financial support — whether it’s a child, aging parent, or even a business partner — you need life insurance. Typically life insurance gets more expensive as you age, so it's smart to get a policy sooner rather than later. Head to policygenius.com to get your free personalized life insurance quotes and see how much you could save.
Head over to Etbulk.com to purchase copies of the New York Best Selling Book You Owe You.

item.title: 355 - We Frankicking
item.description:
In this episode, the guys discuss knowing your value & when to charge for your service or product and share principles that will help you earn your financial freedom.
Don’t miss your opportunity to leverage.
12:25 - “Don’t charge because people are charging. Make sure you have something that’s worth it an sustainable first.”
16:08 - “Provide value where there’s not.” Seek opportunities where you can provide a solution to a problem.
19:39 - “Rushing the process will slow down your growth process.”
39:43 - “Desperation can effect your decision making
Takeaways
Use your income to invest in opportunities that can propel your current leverage.
Give up, to go up.
Let your value speak for itself.
Questions
What’s the last life decision that you’ve made?
What can you guarantee in the value that you’re proposing to companies?

item.title: 354 - Serving Into Legacy
item.description:
In this episode, ET & Cj reflect on the journey & principles they’ve executed to become a New York Times Best Selling Author.
15:59 - “You’ll become successful when you keep the main thing the true focus. Focus on what you truly want to do and accomplish.”
33:02 - “Execute the vision you set for yourself.” Don’t become distracted by what’s going on around you.
42:13 - As a leader, ensure the people who follow you feel loved.
Takeaways
Know when to walk away from opportunities that can take away your initial focus.
Value & embrace your style.
Are you in an establishment phase or sustaining phase of your life?
Listener Perks
Organifi Is giving our listeners up to 20% off of their order! Just go to www.organifi.com/success. Support your journey from sunrise to sunset with fan-favorite superfoods backed by science to replenish micronutrients, support energy and balance hormones from am to pm with our customer favorites.

Amazon pharmacy works with most insurance plans and even has an online representative for assistance during any time of the day or night. Learn more about this convenience at Amazon.com/SUCCESS.
Chime offers help in your financial journey by building your credit history. You can sign up with no annual fees, interest, nor will it affect your credit score. Head over to chime.com/SUCCESS to sign up to receive a secured visa credit card with fee free draft up to a $200.
BABBEL is an app that makes learning a new language fun & easy with no artificial lesson plans! Make your way over to www.babbel.com/SUCCESS to receive up to 60% off of your subscription. Enjoy the perks of lessons, podcast & live classes, and 14 languages to choose from. There's also a Twenty day money back guarantee!

item.title: 353 - More Than A Book
item.description:
The tendency to look at success while overlooking and understanding what it took to get there can be great at times. In this episode, ET & Cj break down ET’s journey through applying systems and principles.
4:03 - “Never let a good crisis go to waste.” Look for positive perspectives in situations deemed unfavorable.
20:00 - Discussion of the origin of You Owe You.
23:36 - “Don’t ask someone to bear your responsibilities.” Please take responsibility for your duties without placing them on other people.
26:37 - Discussion of the financial success within the company. Lessons the company has learned while being aggressive in pursuit of success.
49:30 - “There are people that your story can liberate.” Your truth is, What could set people free. Be confident in sharing Your story.
Takeaways Don’t put your future in someone else’s hands.
Take full responsibility for your life and actions
Learn from your mistakes and those of others.
Join our discord for dialogue about each episode! https://discord.com/channels/926912220351328346/979048981134970994

item.title: 352 - 10 Virgins
item.description:
Picking it up where they left off last week, the guys discuss the necessity of developing patience, the value of helping people in practical ways, and putting forth the type of effort that allows you to obtain things in life for yourself.
“One man’s obedience, disobedience, and health are connected to others people's destinies.”
10:15 - Are you healthy enough emotionally, spiritually, and financially to handle what’s coming your way? Don’t skip the steps of preparation.
17:05 - Follow what God wants you to do more than following the trends of what people want you to do. Stay true to yourself throughout the process without fearing other people's opinions.
20:51 - “Don’t second guess yourself. Trust the decisions you’ve made to get here.” Have confidence in your ability to get the job done. Don’t be afraid of mistakes because they’re a healthy part of every journey.
40:50 - “Don’t bypass the process for people.” We don’t have the authority to help others as God helps us. Direct people to the ultimate source in God!
Takeaways Keeping Moving Forward! Don’t let anything keep you from moving forward.
Help people help themselves instead of enabling them. Help them realize their persistence and drive in the face of their challenges is the key to their success.
Questions
What areas of your life do you need to obtain oil in?
Have you found yourself attempting to play the role of God in other people's lives?
Listener Perks
Organifi Is giving our listeners up to 20% off of their order! Just go to www.organifi.com/success. Support your journey from sunrise to sunset with fan-favorite superfoods backed by science to replenish micronutrients, support energy and balance hormones from am to pm with our customer favorites.
True Classic provides high quality active wear at an affordable price! True Classic supply's your needs from T-Shirts, Shorts, Joggers and Briefs! There's even an option to bundle your order with the Pack Builder that will save you money as well. Head over to www.trueclassic.com/SUCCESS to receive 25% off your order! Free shipping is included on orders over $100.
Policy Genius If someone relies on your financial support — whether it’s a child, aging parent, or even a business partner — you need life insurance. Typically life insurance gets more expensive as you age, so it's smart to get a policy sooner rather than later. Head to policygenius.com to get your free personalized life insurance quotes and see how much you could save.

item.title: 351 - Black And Ugly As Ever
item.description:
Being in the environment along with a successful culture is important for success. In this episode, the guys discuss how those settings should shift your mindset first before behavior can be affected.
“Look in the mirror and demand accountability from yourself!”
10:04 - You Owe You Introduction.
24:39 - “Develop victory in your niche to be able to help others gain victory.”
27:03 - “Success can become your greatest weakness if you put your guard down.” Stay diligent in your routine that brought you success in order to sustain it.
32:35 - “Grow up so you can then grow out.” There are opportunities awaiting you after the development of you character.
39:15 - “Money is not a precursor to health. Internal development and working on mental health is.”
43:50 - “You’re on the path to help when you no longer care what others think about it.”
44:12 - “Don’t let society dictate how you feel about a situation. Don’t be afraid to ask for help in areas needed most.”
Having The It Factor
Comfortable in knowing who you are
Knowing what you bring to the table.
Takeaways
Take control of your situation that brings trouble and sorrow. From there you’ll find life.
Take principles from successful people, then apply it to your life.
Listener Perks
Organifi Is giving our listeners up to 20% off of their order! Just go to www.organifi.com/success. Support your journey from sunrise to sunset with fan-favorite superfoods backed by science to replenish micronutrients, support energy and balance hormones from am to pm with our customer favorites.

Head over to www.mizzenandmain.com to receive $25 dollars off any order of $130 or more.

item.title: 350 - We 50 Now
item.description:
In this episode, the guys discuss the difference between earning, creating, elevating, and “giving” opportunities in your field of interest. The Secret To Success Mindset is also unveiled to being prepared to achieve & sustain success
8:33 - “Stay ready so that when an opportunity comes, you can kill it.” - Jemal
14:05 - “There are opportunities within the opportunity.” Look for ways to improve & elevate the environments you’re placed in.
15:15 - “Opportunities aren’t about money.” Your confidence, individualism, and professionalism can grow in environments. Discern your surroundings for opportunities to grow.
20:21 - “If you don’t know what to work on, work on yourself.” Moose
28:21 - “You can’t lose anything you’re working on.”
31:26 - “Don’t let the present picture distort where you ultimately want to be.”
Turnaround Takeaways
If you want an opportunity, work on yourself until it presents itself.
Hold your weight! Be specific and confident with what you do when speaking to people about opportunities.
Giving opportunities should be mutual. Stray away from presenting one-sided ideas or opportunities. People will be more inclined to help when it benefits both parties.
Questions What are you doing when the opportunity has not presented itself yet? How persistent are you when working on your craft?
Listener Perks
Organifi Is giving our listeners up to 20% off of their order! Just go to www.organifi.com/success. Support your journey from sunrise to sunset with fan-favorite superfoods backed by science to replenish micronutrients, support energy and balance hormones from am to pm with our customer favorites.

item.title: 349 - Bread Winners
item.description:
In this episode, Mark Edmond, Charles Alexander & Jemel Lewis from the Black Bread Company share the story behind creating the first black-owned bread company amidst a global pandemic.
“If a dream has been placed in your heart, You Owe You to see that dream to fruition!” Preorder your copy today! https://etinspires.com/you-owe-you
8:25 - How the Black Bread Company turned an idea into conception.
13:50 - “Get to a point where you don’t have excuses and have solutions instead.”
16:55 - “Put up everything you have.” Investing everything you have and having faith that God will provide is vital in starting.
20:50 - Is your product ready for presentation before reaching out to people that can help?
Takeaways
Don’t be embarrassed to fail.
Don’t tell people about what you’re doing until it’s done—be cautious about who you share your dream with.
Come with action steps each week.
Don’t create products that people don’t need.
Questions Are your friends saying good things about you when you aren’t around?
If your looking to gain equity within the company, head to Blackbreadco.com and click the invest option to join!

item.title: 348 - A Happy Package
item.description:
Adversity will strike us all at some point in our lives. A productive mindset will prepare us to be steadfast during “troubled” times. Listen closely as the guys share their testimonies and insights on the blessings adversity can bring.
26:45 - “If you can only win during the happy and good times, it’ll be hard to win when adversity strikes.”
27:25 - “Growth is the biggest separator of change.”
35:40 - “What you go through strengthens your faith muscle!” Don’t be premature by walking away from pressure of your current situation. There’s a lesson to be learned in those moments. James 1:2-4
Questions Do you abandon trials in life that will elevate you to the next level?
Takeaways Hustle & grind no matter what your current level of success.
Success does not exclude you from having problems in your life.
Break the cycle of thinking when something bad happens, good can’t be produced from it.
Listener Perks
Organifi Is giving our listeners up to 20% off of their order! Just go to www.organifi.com/success. Support your journey from sunrise to sunset with fan-favorite superfoods backed by science to replenish micronutrients, support energy and balance hormones from am to pm with our customer favorites.

item.title: 347 - F***** The GPS
item.description:
Everyone wants to be successful until it’s time to navigate unknown and uncomfortable transitions. In this episode, the guys discuss how you can identify lessons, strengths, and resources that’ll help you break out of familiar patterns.
10:20 - “Keep pushing through the anxiety of the unknown.”
26:45 - What process have you tried your way that hasn’t yielded the desired results? Have you tried someone else’s approach to obtain a different perspective?
41:55 - “Don’t make the fear your focus.”
48:02 - ET breaks down the gathering of different GPS systems along the journey.
54:08 - Anxiety can come from making your journey and destination about you. Think about the people who you’re helping along the way with your testimony.
57:18 - Start working before people help you. People are more inclined to help when they see you putting in the effort first.
GPS - Don’t Aimlessly Drive 1. Know where you are going. Set the vision. 2. Know how long it’ll take. Understand stuff happens along the way. 3. Motion is not progress.
Takeaways Don’t immerse yourself in two different programs with different philosophies. Pick one and stay consistent.
When you know what you want, following blueprints will become easier.
Take the risk!
Listener Perks

Everyone wants to be successful until it’s time to navigate unknown and uncomfortable transitions. In this episode, the guys discuss how you can identify lessons, strengths, and resources that’ll help you break out of familiar patterns. 


10:20 - “Keep pushing through the anxiety of the unknown.”


26:45 - What process have you tried your way that hasn’t yielded the desired results? Have you tried someone else’s approach to obtain a different perspective? 


41:55 - “Don’t make the fear your focus.”


48:02 - ET breaks down the gathering of different GPS systems along the journey. 


54:08 - Anxiety can come from making your journey and destination about you. Think about the people who you’re helping along the way with your testimony. 


57:18 - Start working before people help you. People are more inclined to help when they see you putting in the effort first. 


GPS - Don’t Aimlessly Drive

1. Know where you are going. Set the vision. 

2. Know how long it’ll take. Understand stuff happens along the way. 

3. Motion is not progress. 


Takeaways 

  • Don’t immerse yourself in two different programs with different philosophies. Pick one and stay consistent. 


  • When you know what you want, following blueprints will become easier. 


  • Take the risk!

item.title: 346 - Boo-Boo Bandit
item.description:
Having, obtaining, and keeping leverage can promote you to new heights an experiences in your life. Listen closely as the guys discuss what true leverage is, how to work it successfully, and how to maintain it for the rest of your life.
“If a dream has been placed in your heart, You Owe You to see that dream to fruition!” Preorder your copy today! https://etinspires.com/you-owe-you
11:45 - “As you go up in life, your lifestyle changes.” Perspectives constantly change as your exposure goes up. Don’t shoot down someone’s views if you’ve never experienced it before. Remain positive!
16:50 - Can you produce more from your life but remain stagnant from negative thinking? Be able to recognize the difference of not being able and preferring not to attempt something.
25:32 - “Stop letting people push their agendas on you. Stop being obedient to the views that culture & systems push.”
29:45 - What have you accepted as somebody’s truth for your life? Has their views stopped you from executing the best way you can?
45:26 - “You retain leverage when you have ownership of your brand and product.”
49:34 - “Don’t abandon the responsibilities God has asked you to do.” There is a reward from God for remaining faithful & not getting weary in well doing. Money shouldn’t be a factor in whether you’ll remain faithful to God’s request for you.
Takeaways
Can you not actually get it done, or are you not trying?
What looks excessive to you might look minimal to other people.
Are you giving yourself a fair chance to obtain what you desire?
What do you have to do to accomplish your goal?
Don’t let people talk you out of what God gave you. All you need is one opportunity!
Leverage your relationship into future opportunities versus looking at money every time.
Listener Perks

item.title: 345 - Washed Up
item.description:
In this episode; the guys discuss what leverage is and how to build it successfully. Listen closely as each member gives tangible examples to develop a winning mindset moving forward.
31:22 - Are you executing on what you said you would accomplish? Are you holding yourself accountable to the standards you've set?
37:30 - "Do what you're supposed to do to walk in freedom." Don't wait until a problem occurs to start executing the right way. You owe it to yourself to live successfully every day.
39:30 - "Seek victory and not fairness." Life will deal you a hand full of out-of-control situations, and all you can do to manage that chaos is to control your focus, attitude, and actions despite everything going on around you.
49:15 - "Don't wait for big leverage opportunities to move forward in productivity." Don't despise small beginnings in your journey. Doing things from a pure and genuine heart will never go unnoticed.
1:00:05 - Part one teaser about spending your leverage away. "Obtained leverage comes from sacrifice."
How To Build Leverage • Leverage - Having something that people need. • Provide a Valuable product. • Being available when people inquire about your services. • Focusing on the value you can bring to people. • Don't become comfortable when your success is obtained.
Listener Perks

item.title: 342 - Grumpy Old Men
item.description:
In this episode, the guys alongside Jemal “9 to 5 Millionaire” King discuss changing the narrative when it comes to challenging kids, not giving up on yourself, and remaining humble.
“If a dream has been placed in your heart, You Owe You to see that dream to fruition!” Preorder your copy today! https://etinspires.com/you-owe-you
Intro - ET opens up about challenging & holding kids accountable to be better.
31:28 - “When you stand with the right person you succeed. When you stand with the wrong person you fail.” Evaluate the success of your life to determine how and who you’re currently standing with. Do you need to make changes?
51:04 - “Stay true to yourself to get the most out of the environment that you’re in.” Being prideful can cause you to miss valuable opportunities at hand.
57:01 - Expectations for the 120 Live Conference in Chicago are shared. CJ describes the bigger picture of exposure and building a great network from individuals that will attend the conference.
Turnaround Takeaways Work hard and position yourself to exchange influence an income with people who can help you elevate and grow in new spaces. That pertains to new relationships and business opportunities.
Have you given up on you?
Who are you hanging with that’s influencing your decisions?

item.title: 341 - The Hopers
item.description:
EPS 341
“If a dream has been placed in your heart, You Owe You to see that dream to fruition!”
In this episode, the guys discuss the right mindset that’s needed to obtain & sustain success. They share principles about learning the process, being comfortable in dark moments of your life, and turning your hope into reality.
“You are one process away from being the best creator you can be.”
10:45 - You may experience darkness because of your vision not matching where you’re currently. Those moments are temporary but provide great insight along the journey. Keep the vision alive and consistently work towards the goal!
20:17 - “Accept where you are but have hope to where you want to be.”
26:01 - Having hope originates from having a vision that’s constant on the mind. Putting yourself in environments to nourish your hope is vital in progressing forward.
Takeaways
Improve your quality of life by living in the current moment of today. Enjoy the blessings that God has given you. Take time to reflect on what those blessings are.
There are blessings in the dark moments of your life. It’s hard to understand the reason for experiencing it, but in due time it’ll be revealed. God slows us down for our protection or growth that is needed to sustain the success at the end of your hope.
Listener Perks
Organifi Is giving our listeners up to 20% off of their order! Just go to www.organifi.com/success. Support your journey from sunrise to sunset with fan-favorite superfoods backed by science to replenish micronutrients, support energy and balance hormones from am to pm with our customer favorites.

item.title: 340 - Two-A-Days
item.description:
In this workshop & self reflective episode, the guys share personal testimonies showing how to work on & sustain successful relationships and marriages. They focus on taking accountability, having a vision, and having faith that doesn’t waver during tough times.
Do you get frustrated that people don’t change the way you want them to?
31:09 - “Be intentionally deliberate on making something work in your life.”
38:43 - “Find a way to grow together with your spouse so you don’t grow apart.” Converse openly with each other & address potential issues that can cause separation.
39:15 - “It’s easier to start over than to push through tough times. Find a hunt within a hunt. Hunters look for the recession within the recession.” Create a reason to keep going when environments around you encourage ceasing progress.
53:15 - Apoc Sermon reference link. https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/apoc-ministry/id1448489948?i=1000568628189
1:05:32 - “Look in the mirror and realize what you have to change to start living the life you desire.” You can’t demand change from others when you aren’t willing to. Work to become whole in all areas of your life.
1:09:13 - Are you and your spouse on one accord with the vision that’s provided? The clearer the vision, the more fluent an effectively you can move forward as one.
Turnaround Takeaways
Don’t let insecure tendencies ruin what you have in front of you.
Keep God in the plans he has given you when storms approach. He will see you through it successfully.
Listener Perks
Organifi Is giving our listeners up to 20% off of their order! Just go to www.organifi.com/success. Support your journey from sunrise to sunset with fan-favorite superfoods backed by science to replenish micronutrients, support energy and balance hormones from am to pm with our customer favorites.
Upside is an incredible app for anyone who buys gas, groceries or dines out. With every purchase, you can earn cash back thanks to Upside. Download the FREE Upside App and use promo code SUCCESS to get $5 or more cash back on your first purchase of $10 or more.
BABBEL is an app that makes learning a new language fun & easy with no artificial lesson plans! Make your way over to www.babbel.com/SUCCESS to receive up to 60% off of your subscription. Enjoy the perks of lessons, podcast & live classes &. There's also a Twenty day money back guarantee! SUCCESS
Tiege Hanley is a men’s skin care company that helps guys start and maintain a healthy skin care routine by making the process uncomplicated. Every box comes with an instruction card that tells you when to use each product, how much to use, and in what order. Go to tiege.com/success and you’ll get 30 percent off your first box, plus a FREE gift!

item.title: 339 - Big Brother Tip-Toe
item.description:
In this episode, the guys discuss how going against the grain is necessary for success despite what the community, culture or the closest people to you have contradicting opinions or perspectives about it.
28:10 - Are you willing to go against people you respect opinions to be more of what God called you to be?
30:38 - “Celebration doesn’t happen until the vision is fulfilled. You don’t become until you go against the grain.”
33:28 - Has your thinking shifted to peoples perspective of your journey?
38:26 - If people shut down your thoughts, that’s an indicator to stop sharing news or look for different circles to be around. Who you hang with on a daily basis will become a direct result of failure or success.
50:28 - “Stick with your vision.” Stay with people who support and speak life into your dreams. Sometimes that comes from people you least expect it that will help you sustain the right mindset to success.
1:00:33 - Plunge into your success! Saying you’ll fail before executing an opportunity gives reasons to live with excuses. Don’t be afraid to look crazy going after the life you want to obtain! Every great will convey they went through the same process. You can’t lose something if you don’t risk nothing.”
Takeaways
Who in your life is limiting you? Family, friends, mentors or coaches?
You can dream and visualize more than what your mentors have previously done. Don’t become discouraged if they make comments regarding the success you can achieve. That is the moment you must lock in on your vision even more to avoid regressing along the journey.
Listener Perks
Organifi Is giving our listeners up to 20% off of their order! Just go to www.organifi.com/success. Support your journey from sunrise to sunset with fan-favorite superfoods backed by science to replenish micronutrients, support energy and balance hormones from am to pm with our customer favorites.
Current is an app and debit card that is the future of banking."Get Current for a chance to win $500, go to current.com/success2 or use code SUCCESS2 in the app.”
BABBEL is an app that makes learning a new language fun & easy with no artificial lesson plans! Make your way over to www.babbel.com/SUCCESS to receive up to 60% off of your subscription. Enjoy the perks of lessons, podcast & live classes &. There's also a Twenty day money back guarantee! SUCCESS.

1:00:33 - Plunge into your success! Saying you’ll fail before executing an opportunity gives reasons to live with excuses. Don’t be afraid to look crazy going after the life you want to obtain! Every great will convey they went through the same process. You can’t lose something if you don’t risk nothing.”
Takeaways
Who in your life is limiting you? Family, friends, mentors or coaches?
You can dream and visualize more than what your mentors have previously done. Don’t become discouraged if they make comments regarding the success you can achieve. That is the moment you must lock in on your vision even more to avoid regressing along the journey.

item.title: 338 - Visions And Decisions
item.description:
Decisions are made daily whether they’re good or bad. Becoming an effective decision maker is sum of having a vision while executing actions that support it. Prepare to become encouraged with principles to make better decisions daily that not only effect your life, but others connected to you.
15:45 - “Your life is a result of the decisions you made or didn’t make.” Are your decisions congruent with goals you want to accomplish?
23:01 - “Saying things with energy, having it written on a board doesn’t guarantee something will happen. Those things should drive your decision making.” Evaluate the actions needed in order to achieve the goals you desire. From there, make notes of the types of decisions needed to bring the goal to fruition.
29:01 - “Work on your vision, that will guide your decisions.” A strong belief in your vision should provide consistency in great decision making. Make it a habit to view your vision and goals daily.
35:01 - Independent decisions are individually driven. Keep the team you’re working with involved. You can reach great heights of success alone, but will reach higher levels of success with a team.
51:45 - Great decisions are courageously made. It’s most effective when it’s made quickly & has the best interest of the group. Energy an effort is needed to execute the decision that’s made.
Takeaways
Build credit with others from decisions you make. That credit could be either good or bad.
Position people better with your decision making. Push and help people to reach greater success.
Must be willing to sacrifice, be consistent, and courageous in good making decisions.
Don’t contradict yourself! People will put “pressure” on you to hold your statements accountable.
Listener Perks

item.title: 337 - Don’t Spend Your Freedom
item.description:
The decisions you make today shapes your current situation, future, & other peoples destiny that are directly connected to you. Making good decisions comes at a cost of sacrificing your wants in order to fulfill the needs of the goal. While making bad decisions births consequences that can prolong the process. Listen closely as the guys discuss the mindset, clarity, and focus level needed to obtain & sustain success.
17:15 - “People don’t really want success. They just want the appearance of being successful.” What does success mean to you? Once that is identified, study an execute the routine needed for achieve it.
25:53 - “You are not solely successful just being around someone. You’re successful because of the information you apply.” We must be willing to apply the information received from others living the way we desire to. Don’t deviate from the blueprint that was given, for there are no shortcuts.
48:05 - “Don’t care about the time it takes to obtain something.” If you truly want something in life, focus on the steps needed to be taken in order to get there.
53:01 - Jemal breaks down the difference between current, future, and generational cost. What decisions can you make to impact what’s ahead of you for the better?
Takeaways
Be continuously dedicated to studying and perfecting your craft.
Understand the full process. If you don’t know or fully understand, ask for clarity to walk effectively in action steps.
You would be further along the process if you didn’t look at how long it’s taking or worrying about others people thoughts about your journey.

item.title: 336 - A Good Biscuit
item.description:
People often want you to be involved with the bad decisions that they make consistently. Immersing yourself in their way of thinking can ultimately diminish your future. In this episode, the guys talk about making decisions to sustain the heights of success from making good decisions.
18:41 - “Don’t ever think something is to big or small to pray about. Don’t play Gods role trying to dictate what he will or won’t do.”
34:12 - “You made decisions that will not support growth in your personal or financial statues.” Jemal explains that making bad decisions will lead to more bad opportunities. We have the power of choice to make great decisions. If you’re struggling to do so, surround yourself with people who produce in their life.
43:12 - “Can’t be sympathetic towards others who want your blessings but not the system to help the situation their in.” It can be challenging not feeling guilty about helping people who need it. Fight the feelings of unfortunateness for it can hold you back from reaching greatness.
Takeaways
You attract people who make good decisions when your consistent in making them.
More good than bad opportunities avail themselves personally & financially when you focus more.
Just because something is given to you, the work still needs to be done to be successful. If someone blesses you with an opportunity to grow personally or financially, don’t take it for granted.
Listener Perks

item.title: 335 - The Dopamine Hit
item.description:
The guys pick up from last week's episode on making decisions. They continue to provide more insight into keeping your desires from overriding excellence, effectiveness, and quality in your execution.
“You can do things that are not right and not feel good doing so.”
19:30 - “Don’t skip over doing the real work that will bring success to you.” Cj emphasizes there are no shortcuts on the way to sustainable success.
34:47 - Are you engaging in activities that could tear down what you’ve built up? The more work you put into your craft, family, or self-development, the more costly consequences will be when mistakes are made.
58:01 - “Find a healthy way to receive dopamine.” There are healthy alternatives to receiving those feelings that aren’t destructive to your body or mind.
Discussion Questions 1. What’s your primary reason for making better decisions for your life? 2. Pray to overcome the strength of desires. Having a sinful nature is costly. Not addressing it and doing what it takes to make better life choices directly affect others connected to you. 3. Do you give up the practical for what’s desired in the current moment?
Listener Perks

item.content:encoded:
The guys pick up from last week's episode on making decisions. They continue to provide more insight into keeping your desires from overriding excellence, effectiveness, and quality in your execution.


“You can do things that are not right and not feel good doing so.”


19:30 - “Don’t skip over doing the real work that will bring success to you.” Cj emphasizes there are no shortcuts on the way to sustainable success.


34:47 - Are you engaging in activities that could tear down what you’ve built up? The more work you put into your craft, family, or self-development, the more costly consequences will be when mistakes are made.


58:01 - “Find a healthy way to receive dopamine.” There are healthy alternatives to receiving those feelings that aren’t destructive to your body or mind.


Discussion Questions

    1.   What’s your primary reason for making better decisions for your life?

    2.   Pray to overcome the strength of desires. Having a sinful nature is costly. Not addressing it and doing what it takes to make better life choices directly affect others connected to you.

    3.   Do you give up the practical for what’s desired in the current moment?



Listener Perks

  • ORGANIFI is giving our listeners up to 20% off of their order! Just go to www.organifi.com/success. Support your journey from sunrise to sunset with fan-favorite superfoods backed by science to replenish micronutrients, support energy and balance hormones from am to pm with our customer favorites.


  • CURRENT - For a limited time, we've partnered with Current to give away $1,000. That's right; Current is going to give away $250 to four listeners of our show! All you have to do is Download the Current app and be entered to win $250.00 at current.com/success.

item.title: 334 - The Devil I Know
item.description:
Being placed in the right atmosphere and decision making often determines your ability to grow and succeed. Failure to do so can cause stress, doubt that hinders your ability to progress forward. Listen closely as the guys, with the return of Karl Phillips, discuss perspectives while providing solutions to produce success in your life.
12:25 - “Don’t let unsaid words or feelings manifest into something larger than what it is. Don’t be afraid to speak your mind.”
35:21 - Is the temporary satisfaction more important to you than the long term goal of staying consistent?
56:44 - Build your decision making skills by mastering small decisions in your life. Over time, you will gain confidence to make vital decisions that allows you to grow.
Takeaways
Do you have a clear vision for what you want to accomplish.
What’s your expectations when going into situations involving other people?

item.title: 331 - Decide Or Die
item.description:
In this live episode from Mexico, the guys alongside Jemal “The 9 To 5 King Millionaire” discuss how to make the best decisions for the betterment of your life, relationships, an overall health.
“You can’t make demands if you not making decisions.”
16:20 - Getting far in life has lots to do with small decision making. Its often the ones that are uncomfortable that gets you further in life. Passing those types of test mold and shape you into a great leader while providing ultimate clarity.
22:50 - “Wealthy people make decisions.” -ET
31:50 - “There’s a decision in the decision.” Jemal talks about making a decision within your current situation. Being indecisive or inconsistent in actions produces unstableness & making unnecessary decisions.
52:30 - “Don’t get stuck between making two decisions. People will quit on you when they sense your inability to make one.” - ET
Takeaways
Know your role within the company or group that you’re in. That saves stress and worry from the situation you’re in.
What “ball” is constantly distracting you?
Improve Your Decision Making
Take Risk
Make The Necessary Sacrifices
Listener Perks
Organifi Is giving our listeners up to 20% off of their order! Just go to www.organifi.com/success. Support your journey from sunrise to sunset with fan-favorite superfoods backed by science to replenish micronutrients, support energy and balance hormones from am to pm with our customer favorites.
Tiege Hanley is a men’s skin care company that helps guys start and maintain a healthy skin care routine by making the process uncomplicated. Every box comes with an instruction card that tells you when to use each product, how much to use, and in what order. Go to tiege.com/sucess and you’ll get 30 percent off your first box, plus a FREE gift!

In this live episode from Mexico, the guys alongside Jemal “The 9 To 5 King Millionaire” discuss how to make the best decisions for the betterment of your life, relationships, an overall health. 


“You can’t make demands if you not making decisions.”

31:50 - “There’s a decision in the decision.” Jemal talks about making a decision within your current situation. Being indecisive or inconsistent in actions produces unstableness & making unnecessary decisions.

item.title: 332 - The Warranty
item.description:
Responsibility and accountability are the two front runners that breed success. It can become easy to lose sight of that and only want the end goal in a capitalistic world. In this episode, the guys discuss the reality of taking responsibility and how that fuels financial, health, and relationship success.
18:56 - Don’t focus on the money; focus on the responsibilities needed to make money. Responsibility sustains your ability to be successful.
29:20 - How willing are you to critique your work? Are you brave enough to assess what needs improvement in your life? Faith, fitness, health, & relationships?
Takeaways
Pray in times when needed. Pray for maturity and growth, whether for yourself or someone you love.
Being around people that execute at a high level can naturally attract you to their habits.
Listener Perks
Organifi Is giving our listeners up to 20% off of their order! Just go to www.organifi.com/success. Support your journey from sunrise to sunset with fan-favorite superfoods backed by science to replenish micronutrients, support energy and balance hormones from am to pm with our customer favorites.
InsideTracker If you’re looking for ways to extend your health-span and slow down the aging process, the keys to health and longevity run in your blood. That’s why InsideTracker provides you with a personalized plan to improve and boost your metabolism, reduce stress, improve sleep, and optimize your health for the long haul. Go to insidetracker.com/SUCCESS get a daily Action Plan with personalized guidance on the right exercise, nutrition, and supplementation for your body and for a limited time, get 20% off the entire InsideTracker store.
Birddogs If you are looking for the perfect summer wear, birddogs has you covered. Go to birddogs.com, enter promo code “SUCCESS” and they’ll throw in a free Birddogs Dad Hat.
Hello Fresh Skip trips to the grocery store and count on HelloFresh to make home cooking easy, fun, AND affordable – that’s why it’s America’s #1 meal kit! • Go to HelloFresh.com/success16 and use code success16 for up to 16 free meals AND 3 free gifts!”
Policy Genius If someone relies on your financial support — whether it’s a child, aging parent, or even a business partner — you need life insurance. ****Typically life insurance gets more expensive as you age, so it's smart to get a policy sooner rather than later. Head to policygenius.com to get your free life insurance quotes and see how much you could save.

6:02 - As a leader, be humble and willing to follow your heart in the best interest of helping the people that follow you. Effective leaders make changes with a sense of urgency, speed and great faith.
8:02 - Transition from surviving back to thriving in all areas of your life. At this conference you will receive tools to do so.
22:45 - “If you’re preparing for something the day of, it’s too late.” - Deion Sanders

item.title: 325 - Cinderella
item.description:
In this episode, the guys alongside Jemal “The 9 To 5 King Millionaire” discuss how to obtain an underdog mentality in addition to having strong beliefs.
11:30 - Stop puttin unnecessary pressure on yourself. Perks of that is setting your own expectations on how you operate in your journey.
16:30 - “When you start worrying about other peoples expectations, you can lose focus on your work. You may be viewed as an underdog but your actions must say your a top dog.”
37:30 - If you aren’t operating with a sense of urgency, you will lose. “Pain is the greatest motivator, but it doesn’t have to be.” - Joey
44:22 - Make an adjustment in actions so that you have tangible results to adjust for the better.” - CJ
45:41 - It doesn’t matter what other people think or their expectations of you unless you make it matter.” Listen to opinions from people you value most. People who support you elevates mindsets greatly.
Questions
How are you managing your energy?
Why are you putting energy into everything except for things that doesn’t matter the most?

item.title: 324 - Executionism
item.description:
In this episode, the guys alongside Jemal “The 9 To 5 King Millionaire” and guest Samantha Lorey, discuss the importance of execution while providing how God favors you because of it. Listen carefully to how Jemal breaks down his work ethic on his dream while working his other unfulfilling job.
“It’s not always going to be like that. Execution breeds favoritism. God shows favor when you execute an indulge in obedience.”
22:53 - The mindset is imperative in the vision you broadcast to yourself. You may not be there physically yet, but with consistent actions the goal will be reached. Patience and Trust are needed along the way.
36:33 - Jemal talks about having a long term execution plan for your life. Examine where you want to be 5 years from now, then develop a strategy to get there. Quick success does not mean sustained success. Build your endurance up so that you will lack nothing. James 1:4
39:54 - “Doing what you love gives you energy.” - ET
47:25 - “Excellence doesn’t have an age on it.” Don’t count yourself out from an age perspective. If you can produce at a high level, your gift will make room you regardless of age.
55:44 - Find time in your schedule where you can separate yourself from others. Success is for everyone & is built over time, not overnight.
Three Things Needed For Successful Planning
Have a Vision.
Count your blessings.
Look at your current situations in a positive way.

item.title: 323 - Trick Of The Devil
item.description:
In this episode, the guys alongside Jemal “The 9 To 5 King Millionaire”, discuss that Wanting more in life is great, but the work to get there must be done to obtain it. Each member reminds us of their starting point before reaching the level of success they currently experience.
7:45 - Start where you’re at. Enjoy where you’re at with having the vision of going to where you desire.
22:25 - “You can’t want a certain outcome but be willing to do part of the advice.” - CJ
28:55 - “Foundation is key in the journey of sustainability. - Jemal
39:06 - “Operate in ways you know best at the current moment. Don’t skip the process by looking at the final product.” - Karl

item.title: 322 - Undesirable
item.description:
In this episode, the guys alongside Jemal “The 9 To 5 King Millionaire”, discuss the dangers of listening to opinions from people who offer no value to you or where you’re desiring to be for the future.
Intro - The guys talk about childhood and current celebrity admirations. Which celebrity would leave you shell shocked if you were to meet them?
26:06 - Do the people you interact with have enough value to keep in contact with them? Evaluate how you feel when you converse or are around certain people. That will dictate how you should move forward.
33:12 - “Don’t put too much stock into peoples opinion. It can cause you to be stagnant and have constant worry about how someone views you personally.” - ET
38:13 - Do you value the opinions and values from the people around you?
42:15 - “Everybody has an opinion but that doesn’t mean it’s law or factual. When you come up with a plan for your own life, nobody else sees that plan and vision. If you don’t now ego you are, you’ll find yourself trying to find your keel in their opinions.” - Jemal
49:09 - Do you value conformation over correction? - CJ Listener Perks
Organifi - ORGANIFI is giving our listeners up to 20% off of their order! Just go to www.organifi.com/success. Support your journey from sunrise to sunset with fan-favorite superfoods backed by science to replenish micronutrients, support energy and balance hormones from am to pm with our customer favorites.

item.title: 321 - Karl vs Mal
item.description:
In this episode, the guys alongside Jemal “The 9 To 5 King Millionaire”, discuss the mindset , information, & decision making tactics that teach you how to manage and make money consistently.
The financial position you’re in may not be favorable, but that doesn’t give reasons to splurge uncontrollably. There’s no excuse for not getting educated to make healthier decisions with managing money.
36:11 - Jemal stresses the importance of living your life when budgeting your current expenses. Having a healthy balance is vital to living a good one. Find a system that works for situation and stick to it.
43:40 - Your spending habits should not reflect what others will think about you. Instead it should reflect what’s important to you & what needs to be done. The biblical story of Joseph is a prime example putting away parts of your money. Diligence and mindfulness are keys to growing,saving, and managing your money.
50:25 - “Are you spending money loosely? Or does it have value behind it?” -Jemal
56:50 - What system do you have in place to live life while having the vision to go where you want to be?
1:14:38 - “Sacrifice the thought process you currently have about money to learn the system about gaining money.” -ET
Listener Perks

All you have to do is download the Current app at current.com/success. Winners will be awarded at the end of March, so don't wait! Download the Current app and be entered to win $250.00 at current.com/success.

item.title: 320 - Bad Luck Chuck
item.description:
In this episode, the guys alongside Jemal “The 9 To 5 King Millionaire”, discuss the perspectives of stepping back and humbling yourself and making decisions that you wholeheartedly believe in.
Intro - Discussion of airport terminal etiquette.
25:30 - ET harps on the importance of the decisions that we make. Ask yourself is the next decision going to be in your best interest.
29:41 - Ways to make pure decisions that are best for you include the removal of feelings and fear of rejection/opinions from the equation.
32:20 - Jemal calls everyone to live outside of the comfort zone to walk in the unknown. There’s no secret that his faith gives confidence to do so. Build your faith and trust God to work an obtain what he has for you. Small action steps produce momentum & confidence. That’s how you build faith for something you believe in.
39:30 - “You don’t have bad luck, you have bad motives & shifted priorities that places you in unfavorable positions.”
Are you making any future decisions for yourself? Set some alone time aside each day to think about what needs to be done. Get a game plan for your life.

item.title: 319 - Land, Air & Sea
item.description:
In this episode, the guys alongside Jemal “The 9 To 5 King Millionaire”, discuss loyalty and handling the purpose God provided to you with care. Also, mindset tactics are shared to be successful as you keep growing.
Intro - The team tries out Land, Air, or Sea sandwich and debate whether you call heads or tails on coin flips.
36:34 - “Don’t become loyal to the people and forget the purpose. Don’t put people in place of God.” - ET
45:12 - Being loyal does not mean you drop everything an attend to what someone may need. Look at the principles of what’s being discussed without being emotionally attached to it. You’ll then be able to make more sound decisions.

item.title: 315 - Read The Room
item.description:
In this episode, the guys discuss how to effectively read the room and make the needed adjustments to move forward successfully.
5:30 - Sometimes, a good loss can fire you up in ways a good win can't.
21:05 - "You can learn anything if you're willing to take the time to learn it." -ET
30:45 -Be able to read the room and make the necessary adjustments when needed.
34:30 - What systematic strongholds do you believe you're trapped in? When you learn how to read the room, you can write your future. Envision what you want for your life and be confident in your creation of it.
38:15 - "If I do what has been done by the people in front of me, I will most likely get the same result." -Jemal
43:25 - Readjust your approach to the environment you're in. It wasn't created for your survival, and don't expect what it can' provide.

item.title: 314 - Spilled Milk
item.description:
In this episode, the guys alongside Jemal “The 9 to 5 Millionaire” discuss walking in what’s rightfully yours! After this episode you should begin brainstorming what you want and feel you deserve! People around you can sense when someone is walking with confidence an in their purpose!
7:30 - The gentlemen open up by speaking what they expect to receive in 2022 without necessarily knowing how it’s going to happen but having the belief that it will. What are your goals or wants for the upcoming year?
12:59 - “There’s a difference between what you see and what’s real.” Don’t fall for the illusion. Not showing the internet doesn’t mean it’s not happening.
24:30 - “You walk different when you know you are and where you came from.” -Jemal
37:13 - “It’s hard to acknowledge who you are when you aren’t in alignment with working your mission.”-ET
46:01 - “There should always be something tangible at the end of your work." -ET

item.title: 313 - Fool Me Once
item.description:
Discuss living in a victory mindset instead of living as a victim. Victims believe in a sense of entitlement, which doesn’t elevate you but instead keep you stagnant in life. Be prepared to learn how to receive proper help, get healed from trauma, and start living more wholesome.
9:30 - Professional development takes work.
14:30 - “Most people don’t want help, rather the illusion of wanting help.” Be strong enough to embrace the change that the advice suggest. Don’t let the information go to waste.
19:45 - “If you tell three people your problem, you don’t want help. You want attention.” Sympathy will not elevate you in peoples eyes.
48:30 - Make a decision & progress everyday. Fixate your mind to live in a victors mentality each an every day.
50:01 - When you handle your business in all areas, you more apt to receive help when people recognize the love an energy being put out. Focus on being all in on what you can control.
53:20 - “You can’t borrow your way out of debt.” Cultivate a plan & work it one day at a time.
Listener Perks
ORGANIFI is giving our listeners up to 20% off of their order! Just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime, anywhere while on the go.

item.title: 312 - Land Of No Doubt
item.description:
In this episode, the guys alongside Jemal the ”9 to 5 Millionaire” and guest Bishop Jamie, converse about ways to relieve pressure from situations in your life by engaging in worship and warship. They also engage in the type of commitment you have will determine the experiences lived out.
1:02 - The debate over which Christmas song is the greatest of all time. This Christmas or All I Want for Christmas is you. Out of those two, which one are you picking?
14:10 - Jamie recaps his Dubai experience. He connected his experience to the vision God had showed him. Leaving a lasting impact on him to share with family and friends.
32:30 - Jamie sings to uplift and comfort those whom experienced loss during holiday times.
37:45 - Worship vs Warship. Jamie believes that situations come your way so that you can be a light for others. Whether it’s a gift or calling from God, we should do our best to obey him. He needs you to be a change agent for others!
Worship is praising your way through. Warship is battling the spirt realm that fights against praise with praise.

item.title: 310 - Man Power
item.description:
"Life will be a lot better if you executed instead of tried." ﻿In this episode, the guys alongside Jemal, the 9to5 Millionaire, discuss not giving all of your energy and time into things or people that don't, in some way, benefit you.
3:02 - Dubai recap experience.
22:05 - Don't throw your pearls before swine. Not everyone will understand or appreciate your story.
31:50 - Focus mode. Remain focused, and don't let anything make you lose track of your purpose. Distractions are just that. Side-step them and keep moving forward.
35:02 - The quality of the company you keep is important. Just because you have a shared background with someone is no reason to hang around people that aren't getting the job done. Spend time with people who are driven to succeed and can help you develop that same drive to reach your fullest potential.
40:40 - Just show up. Being in the right place at the right time and in the right spirit is an invaluable experience. Always go where you're celebrated.
47:24 - Put some respect on your circle and never force your way in anywhere. Take the hint. Learn the language and build your own environment.
54:25- Make sure what you do moves the needle toward positive development and supports a healthy, thriving environment for yourself and your family.

item.title: 309 - Du-Bye
item.description:
In this episode, the guys talk about how Executing to the fullest can change based upon the exposure you've received. Be aware of the moments you're in and what can be learned while experiencing those moments.
2:08- Are mashed potatoes considered good food? Join the Great Mashed Potato Debate of 2021 as the guys discuss the importance of prioritizing family time and "acceptable" Thanksgiving meal items.
30:28- Mindset or Environment? Which one dictates your behavior? Your mentality, how you think about everything is important no matter where you are. Embrace the space you're in and get all the exposure you can but, never let your environment overrule your mindset.
35:17- Recap of experiences had while on vacation in Dubai.
37:05- Connect with execution. Seeing how people/companies execute at differing levels can have a positive effect on your mindset. It can genuinely change how you execute personally and professionally in the future. Always demand excellence from yourself and those around you. Never settle.
39:15- "if you're going to do something, go get the full experience from it." Value your family to the fullest. How much you value them is a driving factor for excellence in personal execution. Take ownership and leadership in that area.
ORGANIFI is giving our listeners up to 20% off of their order! Just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime, anywhere while on the go.

item.title: 304 - Stray Dogs
item.description:
"Entrepreneurship is filling the void in the marketplace that the marketplace is calling for consciously or subconsciously. Entrepreneurs look and listen to what is happening in the marketplace and they respond. They also look and listen to what's not happening in the marketplace and they respond as well." These are the words and entrepreneurial philosophy of entrepreneur, radio host, speaker, and owner of The Breakfast Klub, Marcus Davis. Marcus is the epitome of what African-American entrepreneurship can and should look like. Marcus candidly shares his journey toward 20 years of sustained business. Marcus had a vision of being an example of what African-American restaurants can do in the marketplace and he is killing the game. Listen intently, take notes, and be inspired to take your entrepreneurial goals to the next level. Listener Perks

item.title: 303 - Blow it up
item.description:
Blow It Up Each one of us has a mission in life and we spend time meticulously constructing a plan to fulfill this mission. However, did you know that it's highly likely for our plans to fail? In this episode, the guys talk about the importance of focusing on the mission and never losing sight of it even if our plans fail. “There is the mission and then there’s the plan. Many of us get paralyzed because we focus on the plan. The plan paralyzes you. The mission moves you. The mission has momentum. As long as you are about the mission, you will keep moving forward whether or not the plans change.”
Listener Perks
ORGANIFI is giving our listeners up to 20% off of their order! Just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime, anywhere while on the go.

item.title: 300 - The 120 Experience
item.description:
It’s episode 300!!!! Can you believe it? Our 120 LIVE podcast episode is our 300th episode! As we reflect on the last 5 and half years, we want to thank each of our listeners for rocking with us each week. You guys have been with us not only through the evolution of S2S, but also through the ups and downs of our personal and professional lives. Thank you so much!
In this 120 LIVE episode, the guys discuss how it’s impossible to grow in your comfort zone. We only make moves when we are uncomfortable. Many of us are not growing because we are comfortable in our current situations. In order to get to the next level, you have to be okay with feeling uncomfortable. Success is the greatest enemy to success. Feeling as if you have arrived is a dangerous place to be because it leads to complacency and decline. Always seek to grow, push yourself, identify blindspots, and learn something new.
Listener Perks ORGANIFI is giving our listeners up to 20% off of their order! Just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime, anywhere while on the go. QUIP allows you to earn rewards just by brushing your teeth everyday. By using QUIP’s SMART toothbrush you can earn prizes, giftcards, and dental hygiene tips. To start getting rewards for brushing your teeth go to www.getquip.com/success to save $10 on your Smart Electric toothbrush. BLOCKFI bitcoin reward credit card lets you earn an unlimited 1.5% in bitcoin on all qualified purchases. Making everyday purchases puts bitcoin in your pocket. item.title: 299 - The Wrong Tribe
item.description:
Do you mismanage what has been given to you or do you take your time and money and give it to individuals that are not good stewards of what has been given to them? item.title: 296 - Chicago Karl
item.description:
Are you aware of the actions you take and the decisions you make every day? Are you aware of the type of daily example you set for yourself and others? In this episode, the guys discuss the importance of your grind and daily behaviors. On any given day, we make hundreds or even thousands of decisions. These daily decisions can mess us up and delay progression if we aren’t careful. Additionally, we are being watched. A lot of motivation can come from people who observe our daily actions. Whether it’s kids, spouses, or co-workers, can the people that watch you count on you to be that leader by example? Listener Perks

item.title: 295 - Mr. Feel Good
item.description: You have likely heard the mantra "Trust the process" hundreds of times. But what does it really mean? Is trusting the process enough? In today's episode the guys go deep into how you should approach trusting the process that leads you to success. It means that you don't deviate from the process. It also means that you shouldn't rush the process. But most all, you need to MIMIC the process! Be sure to take notes because this podcast is transformational. item.title: 294 - You With You
item.description:
Are you operating in Artificial Confidence? If you're not sure what that is, go back and watch episode 293! In this episode, the guys discuss ways to defeat artificial confidence. Artificial confidence gives control to whoever supplies it. When operating in artificial confidence, your goals will live or die based on the opinions of others. If you don't lose that thought process, you will always be at their mercy. Don't give others that type of control! Defeat artificial confidence. Listener Perks:

item.title: 293 - Artificial Confidence
item.description:
Do you consider yourself to be a confident person? In this episode, the guys discuss how to differentiate between natural and artificial confidence. True confidence comes from knowing who you are (your traits) and whose you are (a child of a loving God). Once you are confident in who you are in the spirit realm and you can activate that confidence in your daily life. When you depend on people liking what you have or getting caught up on what they say, you shift to operating with artificial confidence. Your confidence must always come from within. Listener Perks

item.title: 292 - Pinky's Promise
item.description:
If you are going to be successful you have to wake up daily with a determination to create and execute. In this episode, Eric talks in detail about his experience with Pinky Cole and her team. Pinky is the founder of Slutty Vegan a vegan restaurant in Atlanta, GA. Listener Perks
RESPECT, the remarkable true story of Aretha Franklin, starring Jennifer Hudson, chronicles the rise of Aretha’s musical career from a child singing in her father’s church to her international and iconic fame. Her music has shaped a generation with songs like Think, Respect, and Amazing Grace. This movie boasts an all-star cast including Forrest Whitaker, Mary J. Blige, and Marlon Winans, among others. item.title: 289 - Chutes and Ladders
item.description: "Don't get mad at me because I want to be my best every time I get on the court and you don't. Don't make me the villain because I wanna win and you don't want to win." In life, are you inconsistent in your execution and excellence? Do you allow the environment to determine your energy? In today's episode, the guys are breaking down the importance of being internally motivated to be successful. The difference between the good and the great is that the good need something to get them going, but the greats produce it internally.

item.title: 288 - French Laundry
item.description:
Do you want VIP treatment but fail to grind and hustle like VIP? If you find yourself wanting VIP experiences without having a VIP work ethic, you need to rethink that expectation. In this episode, the guys discuss the importance of personal belief, self-confidence, and being patient with yourself along your journey. Never be weary in well-doing. You shall reap what you sow at the right time. If all the results aren't there yet, keep working and build the type of endurance that lasts through tough times. Commitment, organization, and discipline are extremely important in your personal and professional growth.

item.title: 284 - Karate Karl
item.description:
Do you see the value in every opportunity that comes into your life, even if it's not something that was expected or even desired? Do you complain about where you are in life and then not explore the opportunities are presented to you that could possibly begin the process of moving you toward the life you want because they aren't quite what you were hoping for? In this episode, the guys discuss respecting unexpected opportunities and speaking well of them even if they’re not the ones you want. You never know; maybe this opportunity can be the bridge or stepping stone to the one you want. Like the Good Book says, "Despise not small beginnings."

item.title: 279 - Live From Mexico

Do you get infatuated with your dreams and goals while forgetting that the process to get there is filled with ups and downs? As the guys bask in the beauty of Mexico with a live audience for Phenomenal Life 2021, they share that accepting the process to get your goals is the key to actually achieving them. item.title: 277 - Show Your Work
item.description: Are you a producer or a consumer? In this episode, the guys discuss what it means to have a “Producing” mindset vs. A “Consuming” mindset. The reality is that in order to be successful, you have to produce more than you consume. Jemal shared that “The real value in life is the unseen work being done,” while ET added that “You take the rich (resources) that are around you, and produce wealth with them.” This episode really shows the value of putting in the work, because producing equals longevity.

item.title: 274 - Man in the Arena
item.description: In this episode, the guys discuss Theodore Roosevelt’s "Man In The Arena" quote that provides a thoughtful perspective on criticism. In order to survive criticism, you have to adopt the mindset needed to push through it. It takes discipline to ignore all the critical chatter in your ear while you continue doing what you do even when the results are not evident.

When you produce, execute, and don't need to be "managed" at work, favoritism naturally occurs. When execution is worshipped, those who regularly execute at the highest levels become the "favorites" by default. If you're not a "work favorite," there's probably a reason why. item.title: 269 - Moaning and Groaning
item.description: As you go through your life's journey, you will be presented with opportunities to work with, invest in, and support others. It is a Biblical standard for you to teach others what you know. However, there is a right way and a wrong way to share your knowledge and wisdom with others. In this episode, the guys discuss how to be strategic in providing information to others while planting the seeds, allowing you to control your life. They share words of wisdom and caution such as: Don't throw pearls before swine. By all means, help people develop but, don't just give stuff away. People respect what they have to earn. item.content:encoded:
As you go through your life's journey, you will be presented with opportunities to work with, invest in, and support others. It is a Biblical standard for you to teach others what you know. However, there is a right way and a wrong way to share your knowledge and wisdom with others.

In this episode, the guys discuss how to be strategic in providing information to others while planting the seeds, allowing you to control your life. They share words of wisdom and caution such as:

  • Don't throw pearls before swine. By all means, help people develop but, don't just give stuff away. People respect what they have to earn. When they don't earn it, they don't value it as much.
  • Make sure when you're negotiating with others that the outcome is win-win.

In this episode, the guys & guest Rob Wilson discuss money strategies, investing options, and the mindset needed to thrive in the stock market.

item.title: 266 - Another Man's Salmon
item.description: Are opportunities given or created? In today’s episode, the guys wrestle with this concept and settle on the fact that regardless of how the opportunity originated, what matters most is what we do with it. Through colorful stories (including one about salmon) and some good old fashioned advice, the guys implore us to always seek to be faithful to the opportunities we have and get the most out of them.

item.title: 265 - IT'S OK!
item.description: In life, all of us have roles, responsibilities, and goals to accomplish and fulfill. In order to be successful, the guys discuss knowing your role and doing it to the best of your ability. No matter what your role is, whether that is being a leader or supporter on a team, make sure you're maximizing your position to ensure success. Doing so will always begin with taking action. Don't disrespect the process by looking for or taking shortcuts. That's nothing more than a waste of both time and effort. Do the work to be successful. item.title: 261 - Presex
item.description: As we embark on the New Year, the guys take some time to wrestle with an internal crisis that many of us struggle with at one time or another. There are some situations that warrant having crazy faith. This is where you believe in a positive or promised end, that is not currently visible. This standpoint is contrasted with circumstances in which you are so blinded by what you want, that you are unable to see it for what it is, despite all the contextual clues.

item.title: 260 - The Missing Peace
item.description: This week, in the spirit of the Holiday Season, the guys are joined by nationally syndicated radio personality, activist, actor, & musician, Willie Moore Jr., who engages in a candid and moving dialogue about his life’s journey including being adopted at the age of three months, his journey as an R&B/Hip-Hop artist, rejection from his biological mother, hitting rock bottom financially, and ultimately his rise to the success that he experiences today.

item.title: 259 - Value Meal
item.description:
“Every bite of food that I was talking, was having an effect on my genetic expression.”
Those are the words of today’s guest. We have all heard the expression, you are what you eat. It’s not just a cliche’. It’s a genetic fact. In today’s episode, Shawn Stevenson, author and host of the #1 health podcast, The Model Health Show, shares his journey to discovering the truth about healthy living.

item.title: 258 - Bruce Banner
item.description:
“The more rational your thinking, the more rational your decisions. The more rational your decisions, the probability of the outcomes being great are significantly higher than when you are in an emotional state.”
In today’s episode, the guys are discussing the problem of making decisions based on feelings rather than on what is real, factual, and rational. Commit to making decisions rationally. Your life and legacy depend on it.

item.title: 257 - S.T.A.N.K.
item.description: We make a lot of decisions every day, and with the right energy, we can make every decision, the right decision. The truth is, the energy you give to situations and circumstances in your life is a critical factor to your success. In this episode, the guys speak on how having the right energy, positive attitude, and follow-through can make all the difference in the outcome of decisions.

item.title: 256 - Meat Wagon
item.description:
Yooo….You gotta listen to this one, let it simmer for a bit, and then listen to it again. Jemal pulls you into his journey to becoming the successful entrepreneur he is today by taking you back to some of the most vulnerable moments of his life as a police officer in Chicago.
This one is real, raw, and gives you a much-needed dose of reality to embrace the urgency of this moment and do what it takes to execute on the commitments you've made to better yourself, your family, and your community.

item.title: 255 - The Failure Formula
item.description: "Focus on the process." Those are the words of Jayda, ET's daughter, on today's podcast. 2020 has been a year like no other. COVID-19 has changed everything, and it's easy to feel like your goals and dreams have been left behind. Listen up because today, the guys differentiate between two major types of people and how they plan and execute their goals. Be prepared to take lots of notes because you don't want to miss any of the life-changing actionable tips and strategies they are dropping today.

item.title: 254 - Free Vasectomy
item.description:
ET starts today’s podcast with the quote: ”Excellence is what we repeatedly do.” Over the weekend, CJ celebrated his bday and ET bought him a gift that he never received. ET turns this disappointment into an object lesson for people who want massive success, but their energy and effort don’t match their dreams and goals. While listening to this podcast the guys put emphasis on the importance of being excellent at all times. You can’t make next level money with average service and energy, grab your pen and pads; this one gets deep. item.title: 253 - Sight Fight
item.description:
CJ is heated. That's how Karl and ET describe the seriousness of today's topic. Many aspiring entrepreneurs look for guidance and assistance while building their dreams. But on today's podcast, CJ talks about the people who put their success and dreams into others' hands. Do we need coaches to guide us..yes? Do we need people to bounce ideas off of..sure? But CJ's frustration boils over when people depend on others to make things happen. ET, Jemal, and Karl chime in and discuss how and why people create this false expectation when they're in close quarters with successful people. item.title: 252 - Bad Dad
item.description:
Please go and get a pen and pad! You need to copy and remember every word ET starts this podcast with as he explains his frustration with contradictions. The contradictions of people who say they want success, they’re in the right place to obtain success, have every opportunity to make it happen, but they don’t want to do it what it takes. ET is convinced that the core problem with people who aren’t where they want to be is because they continue to contradict themselves. CJ, Karl, and Jemal chime in, and all the guys self-assess to see where and if they’re contradicting themselves in any area of life.
