item.title: 251 - Capture The Flag
item.description:
Just like on ZOOM calls and face time all across the country, the Lebron discussion is still going on in today’s podcast. With his most recent championship win with the Lakers, the BIG debate has been where Lebron ranks with the well-established GOATS of basketball. Today, ET and the guys talk about how Lebron has captured and planted his flag and, comparatively, how the guys are planting their flags. Naturally, the question to you, the listening/watching audience, is, ”are you planting your flag?” if you’ve tuned in for at least one of our earlier podcasts, you already know the guys are BIG on self-assessment. Today’s episode will put that ball squarely in your court, again. item.title: 250 - The Story Of A King
item.description:
Do you find yourself always giving out discounts to keep or attract new clients? When explaining your services to a prospective client, do you become nervous about sharing your services' costs because you're afraid of their response? Today on the podcast, the guys talk about how to get over the pricing hump and charge what you're worth. At the beginning of E's career, he wasn't getting 5-6 figures a speech. So, there were a few things the guys did to get him there. For today's listeners battling pricing concerns and apprehensions, do you think your anxiety has more to do with self-esteem or, is it a quality of work issue, i.e., you don't believe you're worth what you're asking? How do you stop giving discounts and stick to your price? The guys dig deep and answer these questions for the entrepreneur who's good at what they do but always finds themselves shrinking to please the customer The Secret to Success Topics: [06:32] - Be Like Mike [12:28] - Things Happen [17:54] - Discount Double Check [26:45] - It’s Not The Money [37:00] - Desperation [55:00] - Show Proof [1:12:00] - Busy Person Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. item.title: 249 - Common Law Engagement
item.description:
This week on the podcast, the guys continue discussing accountability versus bullying and the very fine line between them. The guys go back to when they started to work together and discuss how their relationships and roles developed over the years. In those early days, their relationships were different and, so were the levels of accountability between them. But, once the vision became clear, the levels of accountability clearly shifted. How did ET deal with it? Was it bullying at the beginning? The guys tell all as they reflect on where they started, where they are and, how they got there. item.title: 248 - Emergency Wedding
item.description:
Accountability versus bullying. Two terms that most people don't use in the same sentence. Accountability is the obligation to explain, justify, and take responsibility for one's actions. Bullying is someone who intimidates or selfishly coerces people into doing things they don't want to do. Earlier this week, ET discovered that many people live a "bullied life," they've been coerced into, and they're confusing it for accountability. If you're not happy with your life and you find yourself saying yes when you want to say no, then you may be getting bullied. On today's podcast, the guys breakdown the following: When is it okay for someone to hold you accountable? When does accountability turn into bullying? How do you even know when someone is bullying you as an adult? Grab your pen and pad; this is an episode all adults can relate to. The Secret to Success Topics: [05:00] - Lebron James [23:00] - Bullying [31:00] - It’s Dangerous [41:00] - Afraid To Be Wrong [51:27] - The Game [1:10:00] - You Can’t Dictate The Secrets to Success: You’re afraid to say yes to yourself. If you don’t make a decision the bully will make a decision for you. Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. REBUILD Series: www.rebuildseries.com
Study when it’s convenient for you and take your mobile classroom wherever you go. Earn a quality online degree at an accredited college and enjoy all the benefits of the Ashford experience: www.Ashford.edu/success

Accountability versus bullying. Two terms that most people don't use in the same sentence. Accountability is the obligation to explain, justify, and take responsibility for one's actions. Bullying is someone who intimidates or selfishly coerces people into doing things they don't want to do. Earlier this week, ET discovered that many people live a "bullied life," they've been coerced into, and they're confusing it for accountability. If you're not happy with your life and you find yourself saying yes when you want to say no, then you may be getting bullied. On today's podcast, the guys breakdown the following:

  • When is it okay for someone to hold you accountable? 
  • When does accountability turn into bullying?
  • How do you even know when someone is bullying you as an adult? 

Grab your pen and pad; this is an episode all adults can relate to.

The Secret to Success Topics:

  • [05:00] - Lebron James
  • [23:00] - Bullying
  • [31:00] - It’s Dangerous
  • [41:00] - Afraid To Be Wrong
  • [51:27] - The Game
  • [1:10:00] - You Can’t Dictate

The Secrets to Success:

  • You’re afraid to say yes to yourself.
  • If you don’t make a decision the bully will make a decision for you.

item.title: 247 - Credit Card Fraud
item.description:
Last week’s show ruffled a few feathers when Jemal explained why he told Karl not to pay his credit card bill when he received his tax return. Listeners worldwide commented, refuting the advice calling it backward, irresponsible, and downright wrong. Today the guys break down the numbers, and Jemal explains how not paying your credit card bill and leveraging the credit line can help you create wealth and better invest your money. item.title: 246 - Sweet 16
item.description:
On today's podcast, the guys talk about the cost of NOT taking action. You may call yourself a procrastinator; you may call your delays "research" but, we both know the reality is you're afraid to take a chance on yourself. We live in a world where the people who win are the ones who take chances and don't live in the past when they make mistakes. The guys breakdown the dangers of not taking action and how it can and will keep you from becoming the absolute best version of yourself. item.title: 241 - Ain't No Mountain High Enough
item.description:
"Expectation" is defined as a belief that someone will or should achieve something. Today's Podcast begins with ET admitting that he's had to lower expectations for people because, from his experience, people want the rewards without putting in the work. People will say they want things with their mouths, but their work ethic and efforts speak differently. After today's Podcast, take some time to evaluate your life's expectations and ask yourself if your expectations match your efforts. item.title: 240 - The Deep End
item.description:
When someone is drowning, is that the best time to teach them how to swim? On today’s podcast, the guys talk about the unique position you’re in when you’re the ”go-to” person in your family. You’re the one that everyone calls when they’re in a bind or when they need money. How do you determine when you’re truly helping someone versus hurting them? How do you determine how much to give and how often to give? When are you helping versus enabling? The guys review and explain their process of helping those who are truly in need vs. letting others dig themselves out of holes they continue to dig for themselves. item.title: 238 - My Mind's Playing Tricks On Me
item.description:
One thing that the guys feel strongly about is healthy relationships. It Doesn't matter if it's friends, family, or business; interpersonal relationships play a big part in each of the guy's daily lives. On today's podcast, CJ starts the conversation off talking about two good friends who are at odds with each other, and he's found himself in the middle. From the outside looking in, he realizes both parties are highlighting the other's faults that they could each clearly see before the beef kicked off and chose to say nothing about. Now, because they're fighting one another, those problems have taken center stage. Have you ever had a situation where you were at odds with someone and didn't know how to fix it? ET and the guys give practical advice on keeping and sustaining healthy relationships in all areas of your life. The Secret to Success Topics: [05:00] - Trey’s Comedy Corner [08:29] - Horrible Parenting [13:19] - Fair or Foul [17:38] - Brand Loyalty [27:00] - Relationships [42:00] - The Presence [57:00] - Stupid Decision [1:15:00] - Selfish

item.title: 236 - Pass The Joystick
item.description:
Self-discipline is a much more reliable predictor of one’s future success than an IQ score. There are a lot of smart people. They score highly on tests, their comprehension is off the charts, and they always do well in school. But there aren’t a lot of disciplined people. They can’t make or keep commitments; they allow things to distract them when they need to be doing something else. Most importantly, that inability to discipline themselves keeps them from accomplishing their dreams and goals. This week, the guys break down how your approach to self-discipline is the anchor that either keeps you tethered to or away from living the life you’ve always wanted. The Secret to Success Topics: [08:08] - Don’t Ask My Opinion [12:07] - ET & The NBA [17:40] - Fight For Your Spot [30:50] - Which One? [41:00] - Worship The Commitment [1:00:00] - The Reminder The Secrets 2 Success: Self discipline is a much stronger predictor of one’s future success than IQ. When you’re average when the resources run low you’re the first to go. When times get tough you have to be in producer mode not consumer mode. The true dog is not letting yourself stay in the same spot. Find your triggers of things that get you undisciplined. item.title: 235 - Two Kittens
item.description:
Have you ever hired a coach or taken advice from someone you trusted and didn't get the results you wanted? You did everything they told you to do; you took the course, read the book, yet you're still in the same place. On today's podcast, the guys talk about what it takes to get real sustained, permanent change in your life—a change in behavior, and your mindset will lead to the results you want. The Secret to Success Topics: [04:00] - Trey’s Comedy Corner [07:00] - West Coast E [23:30] - Results [30:40] - The Big Gig [40:00] - Perspective Shift [51:28] - Guard The Mind [1:13:00] - Windows Closing The Secrets 2 Success: You can’t talk yourself into something you behaved yourself into. Talking doesn’t change it, you have to work on your behavior. Change your perspective on things so you can do them better. It’s not who you are that holds you back, it's who you think you’re not. item.title: 233 - 10 Miles
item.description:
One of ET's favorite quotes and one he lives by is, "Where your focus goes, your energy flows." On today's podcast, CJ plays a clip of a viral ET moment where E calls out multiple excuses given for why he can't be successful. These excuses are all based on emotion instead of rational thought. Right now, across the country and the world, emotions are running higher than usual and, given current events, this is understandable and, expected. But, we know from experience that decisions and actions taken based on emotion instead of facts and principles don't always give us the outcomes we've sought. Today, ET and the guys offer tangible, strategic steps to creating real and, sustainable change whose roots are anchored in facts, not feelings. item.title: 232 - Lunch and Learn
item.description:
Last week's podcast was heavy, with the guys being painfully transparent about their experiences with racism. This week the conversation focuses on solutions with honorary 5th member of the podcast squad, Josh Hatch, joining the discussion. What are the next steps to educating White people on the realities of systemic racism? How do we make permanent changes in the hearts and minds of the people that will shut down systemic racism and allow equity for everyone? The American Dream should be available to everyone, regardless of skin color, and today, we're going to look at building the blocks to make that happen. item.title: 231 - Pick A Side
item.description: Today's Podcast is being released during one of the most tumultuous and tragic periods in our country's recent history. The past several weeks have seen the murders of innocent Black Americans at the hands of law enforcement-Breonna Taylor and George Floyd. And, the revelation that earlier this year, Ahmaud Arbery, a young Black man out for a run in rural Georgia, had been hunted down and murdered by a band of emboldened and empowered racists. His crime, jogging in a neighborhood they felt he had no business. In the face of these excruciating losses, and after hearing the same bigoted arguments made in justification of their deaths, our country and, the world screamed in unison, "ENOUGH!" We've all had enough. We're fed up with Bigotry, fed up with our communities being underserved and underrepresented and blamed for the ills that lack of support has nurtured, fed up with institutionalized, systemic racism, fed up with blatant in your face racism, inequality and injustice. Collectively, we are tired. Sadly, but not surprisingly, each of the guys has experienced racism and knows it's as American as Apple Pie and Baseball. Today, they've brought their perspectives and experiences to the Podcast. Jemal King, a former police officer, CJ, a bi-racial man, Karl, a native of Barbados, and ET, who grew up in the inner cities of Chicago and Detroit, who's seen it all. Rich or poor, educated or not, racism considers none of that. It discriminates equally and plays itself out in the daily lives of people of color worldwide. Today's Podcast will shed some light on what that continues to look like for this fantastic foursome. The Secret to Success Topics: [01:45] - Trey’s Comedy Corner [07:21] - George Floyd [14:00] - Forever Ago [28:00] - It Ain’t For Them [40:00] - Walk With Us [48:25] - As A Officer [1:03:00] - The Disconnect [1:20:00] - Where Do You Stand? [1:41:00] - Don’t Quit Secrets 2 Success: If you’ve never lived in the jungle you don’t know how the Tiger and the Bears move. Just because you don’t see it doesn’t mean it doesn’t exist. White people can’t thrive in this country without black people. Cry if you will, rest if you must, but don’t quit. Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embody the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. Subscribe to the podcast via Apple Podcasts.

item.title: 230 - You've Got Mail
item.description:
The topic of money is one that most people shy away from. Like, politics, religion, and sex, money is a subject so taboo it's never to be discussed casually, among strangers or, at Holiday, family functions. At least that's what we've always heard. On today's podcast, ET recalls a segment from a recent 1% Conference, where he told attendees to change the way they think about money. Did you know that there are 10 myths about money that are keeping people from being wealthy and prosperous? It's true. Today, ET tears down a few of these myths and shows how holding onto these limiting beliefs about money is holding you back from living your best life. The Secret to Success Topics: [04:04] - Trey’s Comedy Corner
[12:00] - Fair or Foul
[20:18] - Everybody Roll
[35:40] - Collectiveness Society
[43:09] - Bar Alert
[53:00] - Get In Position
[1:00:00] - No Either Or
[1:06:00] - REBUILD

item.itunes:summary:
The topic of money is one that most people shy away from. Like, politics, religion, and sex, money is a subject so taboo it's never to be discussed casually, among strangers or, at Holiday, family functions. At least that's what we've always heard. On today's podcast, ET recalls a segment from a recent 1% Conference, where he told attendees to change the way they think about money. Did you know that there are 10 myths about money that are keeping people from being wealthy and prosperous? It's true. Today, ET tears down a few of these myths and shows how holding onto these limiting beliefs about money is holding you back from living your best life. item.title: 229 - Autocorrect
item.description:
Problem-solving is the process of finding solutions to difficult or complex issues. In today's podcast, the guys talk about two types of individuals—there's the one who wants to solve the problem when it arises, and then there's the one who avoids solving the problem but finds time to blame others, and vent to anyone who will listen. ET breaks down how to go from being the complainer to the solver through understanding and applying the principle of FACTS over FEELINGS.

item.title: 228 - Good Game
item.description:
As the Michael Jordan Documentary, The Last Dance, continues, the guys continue digging deeper into the Winner's Mentality of Michael Jordan. This week the guys each focus on a moment in the documentary that blew them away. Karl speaks on Mike's drive, Jemal is intrigued by Mike's fearlessness, never being afraid to fail and always ready to try. ET ties it all together at the close by focusing on how MJ's Vocabulary set him apart. Words are important. The words we say, we hear and, we manifest our realities through the houses we build with the words we choose. Developing and using a great vocabulary is one of the foundational pillars you'll need to become truly great. The Secret to Success Topics: [05:00] - Trey’s Comedy Corner [7:00] - Drums over Flats [17:20] - Drive vs Dad [25:40] - What Do You Say? [40:00] - The Difference [51:00] - The Edge [1:02:20] - Real Help Listener Perks: Make Real Estate Real Course Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Send your kids to Summer School with ET www.etsummerprogram.com
Streamline your team’s communication, ideas, and projects with Notion. An all inclusive creativity platform for entrepreneurs and their teams. notion.com/success
Text ET at 313-251-1181 and follow us on IG @S2SPodcast Secrets 2 Success: I’m not afraid to fail but I am afraid to NOT try. If people talk to you in a way that makes you feel defeated you need to remove yourself. Great people have a very distinct vocabulary. The next level of success is moving past what you’re physically capable of doing. Stop speaking death and doubt into your life.
Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embody the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. Subscribe to the podcast via Apple Podcasts.

item.title: 227 - Load Management
item.description:
You're not winning because you're not carrying your load correctly! Effective load management is the difference maker between success and failure in both business and private life. These statements set the tone for today's podcast. Many of you want to be successful, and a part of the 1%, but you're holding yourselves back by carrying a load that's not yours to carry or, carrying what is yours, incorrectly. Some of that weight looks like the opinions of parents, siblings, and others who have everything to say about how and what you're doing but aren't doing any of the work. The most critical step to take in effective load management is ignoring the comments and opinions of those whose opinions don't matter. If you're wondering whose opinions "don't matter," and why, here's a clue; if they aren't pulling alongside you, grinding it out with you day in and day out, their opinions don't matter. Period. This week, ET breaks down the three things you're doing that are standing in the way of your success. Effective Load management is the name of the game, and the guys break down what that looks like while offering great insights on how to identify your load limits and apply effective load management in your life and business immediately. The Secret to Success Topics: [03:48] - Trey’s Comedy Corner [10:14] - Fair or Foul [19:30] - Load Management [30:25] - Doing Too Much [43:20] - I Don’t Care [1:05:45] - Ask ET Listener Perks: Make Real Estate Real Course Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Text ET at 313-251-1181 and follow us on IG @S2SPodcast Secrets 2 Success: You’re not winning because you don’t have load management. You will never be successful if you care TOO much about what others think. You have too much on your mind and it’s preventing you from executing. When you learn to do one thing well all the other things will come. Do what you can do and don’t worry about what you can’t do. If you want my help then help me build the wall.
Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embody the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. Subscribe to the podcast via Apple Podcasts.

item.title: 225 - One Pack, One Goal
item.description: Last week the guys took a moment to watch the first installment of "The Last Dance," A documentary focusing on not just the final season but the length and breadth of Michael Jordan's professional basketball career. The guys agreed that although Jordan made it all look so easy and effortless, the levels of adversity, personal trauma, and pain he endured WHILE killing the game was unbelievable. Life happens, and if you didn't know it before COVID-19 straight stopped the entire world in its tracks, you certainly know it now. As the podcast continues, they transition from discussing MJ to discussing the importance of having and maintaining provisions. For those who don't know, provisions are things we stock up on in preparation for times like these, namely, canned goods and other non-perishable items. Essentially, provisions are things that will keep you alive. Like all of you, each of the guys has had a crisis period where they relied on their emotional, spiritual and physical "provisions" to get through the doubt, the pain, and REAL life-altering adversity each one faced. The provisions they stocked up on allowed them to emerge on the other side, better than when they went in. They'll share these stories and more on today's Secret to Success Podcast. The Secret to Success Topics: [03:47] - Trey’s Comedy Corner [14:05] - The Last Dance [26:20] - Execute [35:03] - No Wiggle Room [42:26] - Her Check to Her Check [54:00] - PTSD [1:07:00] - The Feds [1:18:20] - Scared [1:32:00] - Control Listener Perks: Make Real Estate Real Course Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Text ET at 313-251-1181 and follow us on IG @S2SPodcast Secrets 2 Success: Mike had an off and on switch and he never turned it off. Executing is at an all time for people who execute, it’s at an all time low for those who don’t. You got dreams in one corner and COVID in another corner, don’t let COVID win. MJ was confident in the game because of what he did BEFORE the game. Stop cutting it off and cutting it on. Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embody the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. Subscribe to the podcast via Apple Podcasts.

  • Executing is at an all time for people who execute, it’s at an all time low for those who don’t.
  • You got dreams in one corner and COVID in another corner, don’t let COVID win.
  • MJ was confident in the game because of what he did BEFORE the game.
  • Stop cutting it off and cutting it on.

item.title: 224 - The Jackson 4
item.description:
Who's your Mattie Moss Clark? Dr. Mattie Moss Clark was the mother and motivation behind the birth and success of the iconic Gospel Group, The Clark Sisters. ET had a chance to watch the biopic and was inspired by Dr. Mattie Moss Clark, who pushed her girls to greatness in an industry that's full of excellence that doesn't always rise to the top. While studying Dr. Clark's moves and directions, he realized that to be successful at the levels most think they want to be, most people need a Dr. Mattie Moss Clark driving them toward their full potential. Can you push yourself to greatness? Or, do you get upset when other people push you? On today's podcast, the guys discuss how being pushed for the right reasons, and by the right person can lead to outstanding success! item.title: 223 - Survive & Advance
item.description: Two people can live in the same environment and live two totally different experiences. A powerful statement made on today’s podcast by ET. During this pandemic the guys talk about how COVID-19 has affected the African American community at a higher and rapid rate. ET makes the correlation between this fact and why he and squad preaches about becoming a part of the 1%. Not from a financial standpoint but from a holistic standpoint. Being mentally fit, emotionally fit, physically fit, and being fit in your relationships. Today’s podcast will put what it REALLY means to be a part of the 1%. item.title: 222 - April First
item.description: Cause and effect. When you do something it has an effect on something else. The other side is when you don’t do something it still affects something. Last week CJ talked about the difficulties of not having the same routine that he’s had over the last few years. Because he hasn’t had the same routine it was affecting how he went about his day. Today he starts the conversation with somewhat of an epiphany and how although he’s not able to have his normal routine, he still has an opportunity to fix his gaps and increase his strengths. ET rounds out the conversation on what you can do to regain your confidence and how to take advantage of this time instead of letting it pass by. The Secret to Success Topics: [03:13] - Fair or Foul [12:00] - Rona News [19:00] - Cause & Effect [35:00] - Be Careful [50:48] - Survive [1:13:00] - When You Feel Weak [1:25:00] - APOC Listener Perks: The Prescription Album Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Text ET at 313-251-1181 and follow us on IG @S2SPodcast Secrets 2 Success: You now have time to enhance the things you're good at and fix the areas in which you are weak. Stop practicing like you have home court advantage. You don’t The way you train determines how you’re going to play the game. The pre-season is more valuable than the season itself. You’re most vulnerable in transition. Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embodies the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. Subscribe to the podcast via Apple Podcasts.

item.title: 221 - Alarm Clock Needed
item.description: It’s week 2 of being quarantined and the guys are still recording from home. CJ opens up the discussion with the real frustration that some people are experiencing during this pandemic. Frustrated because of misinformation, lack of information, and just not knowing what and who to believe. The conversation shifts into how and why people need to adjust to change during this time. Change isn’t easy and changing against your will is something most of us do not want to do. Today’s podcast reveals the truth about how the guys are dealing with this change and how you can adjust and make the best of the quarantine. The Secret to Success Topics: [03:00] - Trey’s Comedy Corner [04:50] - Quarantine Life [17:00] - Frustration [26:30] - Podcast Challenge [32:00] - The Shift [40:00] - Prepare For Change [1:02:30] - Hole 14 [1:18:10] - Ask ET Listener Perks: The Prescription Album Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Text ET at 313-251-1181 and follow us on IG @S2SPodcast Secrets 2 Success: Your body is designed to protect you from change. Two things in life are inevitable, death and change. This is not a physical fight, this is a mental battle. Prepare for change before change happens. The adjustment is making me adjust. Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embodies the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. Subscribe to the podcast via Apple Podcasts.

item.title: 220 - The Quaranteam
item.description:
The guys are back this week looking to offer some reassurance and calm amid the chaos that the world is currently experiencing. The Coronavirus has everyone on edge, and this week, Karl, CJ, ET and Jemal chop it up on surviving and thriving during the Covid-19 crisis. In all things, it’s important to ”stay ahead of the curve.” Doubly so when it comes to disaster preparedness, and that means exercising ”forward-thinking” regarding personal and professional finances, family, and life in general. The Coronavirus crisis will pass, and today’s podcast is designed to offer you the best footing for rebuilding once this crisis has ended.
The Secret to Success Topics: [04:30] - Overly Cautious [20:30] - Quarantine Snacks [26:25] - Real March Madness [34:14] - Ahead of the Curve [51:40] - Jemal King LIVE [57:00] - The Prescription [1:09:25] - Evaluate [1:15:00] - Do The Difficult Listener Perks: The Prescription Album Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Study when it’s convenient for you and take your mobile classroom wherever you go. Earn a quality online degree at an accredited college and enjoy all the benefits of the Ashford experience: www.Ashford.edu/success
Text ET at 313-251-1181 Secrets 2 Success: Some of you are killing yourself because you’re overthinking. What are you going to do to recession proof your family? Create the environment you want to live in. What you think is stable ain’t stable. In order to get to the next level you have to do the difficult. item.title: 218 - Quadruple Sink
item.description:
Everyone wants to be great and be successful, but how many of you show up every day? On today’s podcast, ET talks about the importance of NOT checking out while on your journey to success. Life happens to everyone, but people who become GREAT keep pushing no matter what. While the greats keep pushing and elevating, ET talks to the people who are going AWOL and not showing up consistently. Not showing up in their business, in their marriage, and they wonder why they’re still average. Take notes from today’s episode on the process and importance of showing up consistently. The Secret to Success Topics: [07:15] - Valentine’s Day [13:50] - Go To Bed [17:11] - AWOL [26:00] - Show Up [45:08] - Don’t Compromise [1:01:00] - No More Ideas [1:15:00] - Coach K Moment Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Join the 1% Club For the Sermon mentioned in today’s Episode click HERE
Secrets 2 Success: A part of being successful is NOT going AWOL. You can’t go AWOL and expect to get the privileges that successful people have. You can not physically clock in and clock out. You can own what happens to you internally. The only way you shift your perspective is to think of others.
ET Events: 1% Tour Make Real Estate Real

item.title: 217 - What Happened To Your Hearts
item.description:
"Of all the things you can be, why be a taker? I've never understood that mindset. I mean, how do you decide to take something and give nothing in return? " -ET. Today's podcast is a hot one and the issue of "Takers Vs. Givers" is just one of the several points covered in today's session. Success is an incredible attraction, and, as everyone on the squad continues their elevation in both business and private life, more and more people want in on the circle. The problem is, some but not all of these "new people" have brought with them three particularly nasty spirits. Complaining, manipulation, and taking. If you know anything about E, C, Karl, Mal & the Squad, then you already know, these are 3 Things that the squad doesn’t tolerate. As ever, ETA's very own "Quincy Jones" AKA CJ, plays devil’s advocate when the conversation shifts to the topic of how and when to charge for your services. Today's show covers a myriad of relevant topics and the passion from the guys and their special in-studio guests will have you glued to your headphones! Trust me; if you're in the process of building anything, a business, personal, and professional relationships, or anything else, you'll need to hear what's about to go down today! Grab a friend, grab a pen, and settle in. Today's the day we make it plain! Don’t forget to subscribe, leave a review, and follow us at @S2Spodcast. The Secret to Success Topics: [03:15] - You Getting Old [15:50] - I Need Your Card [25:40] - The Decision [37:20] - When Is It Time [47:49] - Go Off [1:00:00] - You Eat Good [1:19:00] - Are You Taking or Giving? [1:30:00] - Kulture [1:46:00] - Have An Impact Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Study when it’s convenient for you and take your mobile classroom wherever you go. Earn a quality online degree at an accredited college and enjoy all the benefits of the Ashford experience: www.Ashford.edu/success
DCinvestllc.com Invest in real estate in the DMV area Secrets 2 Success: People never see an opportunity unless there’s a check attached to it. A takers mentality allows you to miss a window of opportunity. An investor’s mentality allows you to do things today that pay you down the road. Don’t come to a potluck empty handed. You can’t be family only when you want to be family. When you do things don’t look at it like you’re losing something, you’re investing. "Of all the things you can be, why be a taker?  I've never understood that mindset. I mean, how do you decide to take something and give nothing in return? " -ET.

Today's podcast is a hot one and the issue of "Takers Vs. Givers" is just one of the several points covered in today's session. Success is an incredible attraction, and, as everyone on the squad continues their elevation in both business and private life, more and more people want in on the circle.  The problem is, some but not all of these "new people" have brought with them three particularly nasty spirits. Complaining, manipulation, and taking. If you know anything about E, C, Karl, Mal & the Squad, then you already know, these are 3 Things that the squad doesn’t tolerate. 

As ever, ETA's very own "Quincy Jones" AKA CJ, plays devil’s advocate when the conversation shifts to the topic of how and when to charge for your services. Today's show covers a myriad of relevant topics and the passion from the guys and their special in-studio guests will have you glued to your headphones!  

Trust me; if you're in the process of building anything, a business, personal, and professional relationships, or anything else,  you'll need to hear what's about to go down today! Grab a friend, grab a pen, and settle in. Today's the day we make it plain!

item.title: 216 - Compound Problems
item.description:
Everyone has challenges but there are some people who allow these challenges to hold them back. On today’s podcast ET talks about the difference between people who fight the challenges and the ones who let the challenges defeat them. CJ chimes in on how important it is to stop focusing on the challenge itself and work towards a solution. Where your focus goes your energy flows and today’s podcast will help you refocus. The Secret to Success Topics: [05:00] - Rich Friends [10:45] - Challenges [17:40] - Don’t Be Weak [26:45] - Preach CJ [43:00] - Solution Oriented [1:04:00] - Go Get It Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Study when it’s convenient for you and take your mobile classroom wherever you go. Earn a quality online degree at an accredited college and enjoy all the benefits of the Ashford experience: www.Ashford.edu/success
Secrets 2 Success: If you handle it weak you’re teaching your kids to handle it weak. You don’t need your emotions to make a decision. Focusing on your problem will never get you anywhere. You don’t have to change a lot when you have the right mindset. The real work is in changing your mindset. item.title: 213 - The Sailor Man
item.description:
It’s better to give than receive. One of the golden rules in life that so many forget about. Today on the podcast ET brings up the topic of having a giving versus receiving mentality. How it actually blesses you to put the needs of others before your own. How to make it a habit in your life even when you may be around people who aren’t reciprocating the concept. CJ rounds out the conversation on how being selfless is what led E to building the all-star cast he has around him. Take notes on how and why you should live with the mentality of wanting to give before you receive. The Secret to Success Topics: [04:55] - Popeye’s Sandwich [13:20] - The Ultimate Sacrifice [22:00] - Don’t Kill the Flock [30:00] - Principles Over Money [42:20] - TEAM [56:00] - Who is Eric Thomas? Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Study when it’s convenient for you and take your mobile classroom wherever you go. Earn a quality online degree at an accredited college and enjoy all the benefits of the Ashford experience: www.Ashford.edu/success
DCinvestllc.com Invest in real estate in the DMV area Secrets 2 Success: People who look after themselves are in a jungle. The biblical principle is to GIVE more than you receive. You’re not doing anything special when you do for your own. God created you to create opportunities for others. When you’re a taker you stop your momentum. item.title: 212 - Human Nature
item.description:
Exposure;the state of being exposed to contact with something. Seeing something or experiencing something outside of what you normally see. On today’s podcast the guys talk about things that they were exposed to that literally changed the trajectory of their lives. E tells a story about a mentor who showed him fancy restaurants and hotels. CJ talks about the impact ET had on him when they first started traveling and speaking. All of the guys discuss how critical exposure was then, and how critical exposure is now on the journey to success. What are you exposing yourself to? Are you intentionally putting yourselves in environments that will push you to become great? If not this podcast will light the fire for you to do so. The Secret to Success Topics: [03:30] - MLK Day [15:37] - Exposure [34:23] - People Live Like This [48:21] - Obedience and Destiny [1:07:00] - Nugget of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Study when it’s convenient for you and take your mobile classroom wherever you go. Earn a quality online degree at an accredited college and enjoy all the benefits of the Ashford experience: www.Ashford.edu/success
DCinvestllc.com Invest in real estate in the DMV area Secrets 2 Success: Before a seed can grow it has to die. The dark parts are important because it weeds people out of your life. People abort their mission so fast because it doesn’t look like what they want it to. Exposure is more important than money. Exposure gives you the process that gets you to the end. item.title: 211 - Middle Class Millionaires
item.description:
This week on the podcast Tiphani Montgomery joins the podcast as the guys wrap up the 1st stop on the 2020 1% Tour. ET kicks off the conversation as he’s been frustrated with his success just a little bit. When you obtain a level success but many of your friends and family expect you to hand opportunities and money to them. ET calls on his board of advisors to give listeners a step by step playbook of how to get over that hump so you can give more than you receive. The Secret to Success Topics: [07:38] - Scary Moment [21:20] - It’s Hard Having Money [35:00] - Human Nature [50:00] - Get vs Give [1:00:00] - Delayed Gratification Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Study when it’s convenient for you and take your mobile classroom wherever you go. Earn a quality online degree at an accredited college and enjoy all the benefits of the Ashford experience: www.Ashford.edu/success
Secrets 2 Success: Execute don’t just make attempts. A poverty mindset is what can I get, a wealthy mindset is what can I give? A poverty mindset is taking everything someone gives you. The money comes after the mindset. Just because you say you want it doesn’t mean you really want it. item.title: 209 - Keto Killer
item.description:
Sustain. To support, hold up, bear from below. Everyone talks a LOT about becoming successful and reaching goals. But what does it take to sustain it? On today’s podcast, CJ asks Jemal, ET, Josh, and Karl how they’ve been able to not only sustain their success but how they’ve been able to increase it. The mental toughness, the importance of keeping the vision alive, and how to keep believing if you’re in a position where you haven’t yet reached success. It’s all talked about on today’s podcast and it’s the perfect conversation to start the year. The Secret to Success Topics: [04:29] - Fair or Foul [15:00] - Sustain [24:14] - Healthy Fear [40:42] - Growth [1:02:00] - Crazy Faith Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Get fresh pre-measured ingredients delivered straight to your door. Hello Fresh is our choice for meal planning for ourselves and our families. For a limited time get 9 FREE meals by visiting www.hellofresh.com/success9 and use the promo code “SUCCESS9”
Secrets of the 1%: If you always try to get better you can’t catch that. Have an insatiable desire to be better. ET Events: 2020 1% Tour Phenomenal Life 2020

item.title: 207 - Tent Maker
item.description:
Two things that ETA organization embody is accountability and self-awareness. Your ability to be honest about yourself and your situation is the foundation to changing your life. Today on the podcast the guys discuss how your inability to self-assess can keep you in denial and stuck. Denial is a pain killer and blaming others can and will keep you in the same position that you’re complaining about. Be prepared for a reality check on today’s show to see how aware you are. The Secret to Success Topics: [06:15] - Get Humbled [10:00] - Fair or Foul [22:00] - Denial [38:00] - Rage [52:00] - Hold Me Accountable [1:03:00] - Get Around the Right People Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Get fresh pre-measured ingredients delivered straight to your door. Hello Fresh is our choice for meal planning for ourselves and our families. For a limited time get 9 FREE meals by visiting www.hellofresh.com/success9 and use the promo code “SUCCESS9”
Study when it’s convenient for you and take your mobile classroom wherever you go. Earn a quality online degree at an accredited college and enjoy all the benefits of the Ashford experience: www.Ashford.edu/success
Secrets of the 1%: Denial is a pain killer. Your ego will keep you in the same position. Take inventory of who you really are versus who people think you are. The first part of recovery is acknowledging you have a problem. Get around people who make you feel uncomfortable. ET Events: 2020 1% Tour Phenomenal Life 2020 Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embodies the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. item.title: 206 - Show Up to Blow Up
item.description:
Everyone wants to be happy and live a fruitful life. You have big dreams but you don’t know the vehicle you’re taking or even the complete destination. A lot of you listening have this big grand vision but you’re lacking the plan and/or the execution to make the vision come to life. On today’s podcast, the guy’s talk about how their vision became a reality. While listening you’ll learn what it takes to make your vision come to past not only by executing but how to do with precise planning. The Secret to Success Topics: [05:25] - Fair or Foul [20:35] - The Plan [33:00] - Show Up [45:00] - Karl Stayed [1:04:00] - The World Changed [1:10:00] - Ask ET Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Get fresh pre-measured ingredients delivered straight to your door. Hello Fresh is our choice for meal planning for ourselves and our families. For a limited time get 9 FREE meals by visiting www.hellofresh.com/success9 and use the promo code “SUCCESS9”
Study when it’s convenient for you and take your mobile classroom wherever you go. Earn a quality online degree at an accredited college and enjoy all the benefits of the Ashford experience: www.Ashford.edu/success
Secrets 2 Success: The reason you can’t do what you want to do is because you’re average. Your vision won’t become a reality if you don’t learn how to show up every day. You can’t ask people to take you seriously when you don’t show up. You’re self-sabotaging by being all over the place. ET Events: 2020 1% Tour Phenomenal Life 2020 Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embodies the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. item.title: 205 - The Hangover
item.description:
There’s a belief that everyone wants to do well in life. No one wants to suffer or face financial hardships their entire life. The difference between those become a part of the 1% and those who don’t is applied information. On today’s podcast, the guys discuss the power of applied information and how it’s changed all of their lives. The power of applied information provides you options to live a life that no one in your family has ever experienced. Listen to today’s podcast with an open mind be ready to figure out what you want out of life what information you need to make it come to fruition. The Secret to Success Topics: [04:10] - Jemal’s Proposal [12:00] - First Class [25:17] - Applied Information [38:50] - Options [50:12] - Don’t Chase The Money [1:22:10] - Nugget of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Get fresh pre-measured ingredients delivered straight to your door. Hello Fresh is our choice for meal planning for ourselves and our families. For a limited time get 9 FREE meals by visiting www.hellofresh.com/success9 and use the promo code “SUCCESS9”
Secrets 2 Success: Applied Information is the only thing separating you from the 1%. It’s harder to work and make money versus making money using information. item.title: 203 - Complete The Process
item.description:
You have the idea. You make the business plan. You build the website. But something along the way didn’t connect and you didn’t launch the business. Or you didn’t finish the book. Does this strike a nerve? If it doesn’t today’s podcast will as the guys discuss the importance of completion. Many people get opportunities or start something but they never actually complete anything to experience the success they want. Take notes and learn what completion looks like so you can become a part of the 1%. The Secret to Success Topics: [05:30] - Favorite Dish [19:30] - Losers Lose [30:31] - Completion [41:05] - Verbal Masturbation [55:00] - One Step Away [1:05:00] - Nicky Chimes In Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Study when it’s convenient for you and take your mobile classroom wherever you go. Earn a quality online degree at an accredited college and enjoy all the benefits of the Ashford experience: www.Ashford.edu/success
Secrets 2 Success: Execute don’t just make attempts. Completion needs to be a habit. When you start and stop things constantly you tarnish your credibility. item.title: 202 - Harriet
item.description:
This week on the podcast the guys discuss the impact of the movie Harriet. The film Harriet showcased the journey of Harriet Tubman freeing herself as a slave and then returning to free hundreds of others. The guys use examples from the movie in correlation to their journey on the road to success. Subjects such as the things that cause you to fear. The importance of watching what you allow in your spirit. Ladies and gentlemen get ready to have a gut check about your journey, your life, and most importantly your freedom. The Secret to Success Topics: [06:40] - Friends That Ball [13:25] - Disrupting Society [33:00] - Fear Is Your Enemy [47:15] - Scared of Pain [55:00] - Keep the Fuel [1:11:43] - Nugget of the Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Capital Invest is a real estate investment company in the DMV area https://capitalinvestllc.com

item.title: 200 - Tear Down The Wall
item.description:
Money. A subject that can be looked at as taboo in some families and communities. Most people don’t talk about money. Especially individuals who don’t have much of it. On today’s podcast the guys, along with Jemal King, talk about what life is like you’re financially free. But most importantly how to become financially free. How do you increase your income without getting another job? How do you educate yourself on the rules of money? The guys dig real deep into the possibilities and the reality of making money. The Secret to Success Topics: [03:15] - Separate Bank Accounts [10:00] - Different Exposure [23:42] - Buildings Over Bank Accounts [32:00] - Gutting the Mindset [46:13] - Operate in Abundance [1:10:30] - Make Real Estate Real Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Jemal King’s Real Estate Program www.makerealestatereal.com/podcast
Capital Invest is a real estate investment company in the DMV area https://capitalinvestllc.com

To change their mind you have to change their reality. Have a purpose for every property you purchase. Masters of The Game Private Mastermind

item.title: 199 - You Need Your Help
item.description:
The guys are back this week with a continuation of last week’s conversation. The have’s vs the have nots. CJ starts the conversation with the topic of surrounding yourself with the 1%. ET suggests that everyone should get around the 1% while CJ talks about getting around the people who are right above you FIRST. This requires self-assessment but it also allows you to get around the 1% organically. After listening to this podcast if you’re not around the 1% ask yourself what does the 1% NEED and how can you add value. item.title: 198 - Imma Finish Him
item.description:
Excuses. To make an apology for; to try to remove from. An excuse is something we’ve all had and probably used multiple times in our lives. But what happens when you allow excuses to stop you or keep you stagnant? Today on the podcast ET and the guys wax deep on the difference between overcoming the excuses and allowing the excuses to stop you. ET gives tangible steps and tips on how to get yourself on the other side instead of using excuses to hold you back. The Secret to Success Topics: [08:14] - Parent-Teacher Conference [15:14] - Lions Robbed [27:20] - 2 Things Exist [40:00] - Semi-Have’s [57:25] - Exposure Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. item.title: 197 - Deep Practice
item.description:
Who likes to be wrong? No one. Who enjoys making mistakes? Not one person on this Earth. But how many of you take ownership when you’re wrong or when you make a mistake. On today’s show, the guys talk about how to properly take ownership when you find yourself in a situation that’s your fault. Most people blame someone else or make an excuse when the proper thing to do is to take ownership and find a real solution to the problem. Take some time after listening to today’s podcast and ask yourself do you take ownership or do you play the blame game. The Secret to Success Topics: [03:20] - Am I Tripping Or? [11:11] - Accountability [23:40] - The Talent Code [36:30] - Time With Your Gift [49:00] - How To Get To Mastery [1:05:10] - Ask ET [1:26:00] - Nugget Of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Earn a quality online degree at an accredited college and enjoy all the benefits of the Ashford experience: www.Ashford.edu/success
Get fresh pre-measured ingredients delivered straight to your door. Hello Fresh is our choice for meal planning for ourselves and our families. Get $80 off your first month by using the promo code “SUCCESS80”

A part of deep practice is not doing what you’re NOT supposed to do. One real encounter is more valuable than several hundred observations. item.title: 194 - Father Figure
item.description:
They said Kobe Bryant was the first one in the gym and the last to leave. They always release reports on the amount of money Lebron James invests in his body so that he can get better. There are countless stories and examples of individuals who have accomplished great things yet they still invest in themselves. Today on the podcast the guys dissect the difference between the individuals who invest in themselves and the individuals who don’t. Grab your pen and paper because it is time to once again, self-assess. The Secret to Success Topics: [08:32] - What’s on ET’s Mind [17:00] - Momentum [24:00] - Juice Theory [39:00] - Mostafa Chimes In [50:00] - Get Out of The Grey Area [1:10:00] - Make Sure It’s Worth It [1:24:00] - Nugget of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. If you’re generating over $10,000 in revenue our partners at Clearbanc have an amazing offer for you. Just visit Clearbanc.com/success
Secrets 2 Success: Do not look over the power of observation. The only way to not go backward is to keep going forward. Decide where your learning will come from. It’s easy to change when you change your mind first. Do something that will bring meaningful results. Masters of The Game Private Mastermind ET Events: Phenomenal Life 2020

item.title: 193 - ET The Explorer
item.description:
System. A set of things working together as parts of a mechanism or an interconnecting network. What does your system look like? Do you even have a system? On today’s podcast, the guys talk about the importance of recognizing and understanding the system you’re in. Especially the systems you’re in that you do not like. The system of having a 9-5 you hate, the system of being in a relationship you know you don’t want to be in. Whatever your system is are you happy in that system? The challenge you to identify, assess, and then make a decision on whether or not you’re in the right system. Grab your pen and paper, you will need to take notes. The Secret to Success Topics: [06:20] - Lame Lions [18:20] - System vs Talent [33:00] - Living A Past Life [48:00] - Becoming The Right Person [1:00:15] - Ask ET [1:14:18] - Nugget of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Get fresh pre-measured ingredients delivered straight to your door. Hello Fresh is our choice for meal planning for ourselves and our families. Get $80 off your first month by using the promo code “SUCCESS80”
Secrets 2 Success: When you become a master at your craft there are certain things you can get away with that others can’t. Take 10 minutes a day to sit and see yourself where you want to be in life. If you don’t master your craft that means the master is mastering you. Be so good at your craft that if you got kicked off of your team someone else would want you. If you don’t love it, you don’t have to keep doing it. Transform Your Habits Video ET Events: Phenomenal Life 2020

item.title: 192 - The Failure Plan
item.description:
As an owner, there’s an all or nothing attitude that goes into your effort. An employee mindset warrants an “I tried” mindset. On today’s podcast, the guys discuss the difference between individuals who “try” and individuals who flat out get it done. People who “try” often want credit for the effort and the guys talk about how trying means nothing if you don’t secure the bag. This podcast will make you stop and think about the mentality you’ve adopted. Is it an ownership mindset or an employee mindset? The difference between the two will determine the level of your success. Time Stamped Topics: [04:50] - Happy Birthday E! [14:07] - Working on Mastery [24:34] - Tobe on 2K [39:00] - Staff Meeting [50:40] - Partial Credit [1:01:20] - The Danger [1:07:00] - Karl’s Ownership [1:13:00] - Next Level Ownership [1:25:00] - Nugget of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Secrets 2 Success: Securing the bag and making sure the money is in the account is the only thing that matters. Almost getting something means NOTHING. A fool takes no pleasure in understanding. Win and lose based on your OWN efforts. How you do anything is how you do EVERYTHING. You can’t put your happiness and success is someone else’s hands and get mad if it doesn’t work out. You should be working towards ownership in EVERY part of your life. ET Events: Phenomenal Life 2020
1% Club New Orleans September 12, 2019
1% Club DC Oct. 5-6 Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embodies the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. Subscribe to the podcast via Apple Podcasts.

item.title: 190 - Get on The Scale
item.description:
When you have a goal to lose weight before you start working out or hire a trainer what’s the first thing you do? Normally it’s stepping on the scale to get a starting point. After that, you set a goal weight. From that moment forward you continue to get on the scale to measure your progress to make sure you stay on track. This is the process for losing weight and it should also be the process when you’re going after any other dream or goal. Today the guys discuss the importance of understanding where you are and being honest about it so that you can move towards where you want to be. item.itunes:subtitle: When you have a goal to lose weight before you start working out or hire a trainer what’s the first thing you do? Normally it’s stepping on the scale to get a starting point. After that, you set a goal weight. From that moment forward you continue...
item.itunes:summary:
When you have a goal to lose weight before you start working out or hire a trainer what’s the first thing you do? Normally it’s stepping on the scale to get a starting point. After that, you set a goal weight. From that moment forward you continue to get on the scale to measure your progress to make sure you stay on track. This is the process for losing weight and it should also be the process when you’re going after any other dream or goal. Today the guys discuss the importance of understanding where you are and being honest about it so that you can move towards where you want to be. item.title: 189 - Don't Take This The Wrong Way
item.description:
Oftentimes when you’re on a journey to make your dreams come true you run into obstacles. Some obstacles are bigger than others but the most common obstacle is not having the support from the people you want it from. This could be your spouse, significant other, parents, or friends. Today on the podcast the guys discuss who and what really affects your happiness. Are you giving the responsibility of your dreams or goals to someone else? Are you depending on someone else to remain happy? Get ready to self-assess after listening to the importance of being able to esteem yourself. Time Stamped Topics: [03:00] - ET Can’t Go Anywhere [13:50] - CJ Travel Story [22:00] - Verified Re-Cap [36:15] - Who Affects Your Happiness? item.title: 187: The 9th Mile
item.description:
Savage life. A life of being great at what you do. A life where you become one of the top people in your field. The life that helps you become a part of the 1%. On today’s podcast, CJ talks about the importance of becoming a savage and doing it the right way. If you ever plan on being great or being apart of the 1% you have to learn how to be a savage. Grab your pen and paper, get ready to take notes and learn how to become a savage. Time Stamped Topics: [03:20] - Trey’s Comedy Corner [06:00] - Karl’s Steps [17:25] - FREE Does Cost [24:00] - On Purpose [30:00] - The Art of Savagery [57:18] - Jemal Chimes In [1:10:00] - Invest In Yourself [1:19:00] - Focus on The Training Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Get fresh pre-measured ingredients delivered straight to your door with our sponsor Hello Fresh. Get $80 off your first month by using the promo code “SUCCESS80”
Turn your passion into a profit with ETA’S certified speaking program. Visit www.etagamechangers.com. The Secrets to Success: Do not do anything where you don’t have a reason as to why you’re doing it. If you’re not a savage invest in yourself to become a savage. In order to attract a savage you must become a savage. It’s the process you should be clamoring over not the product. People who aren’t running your pace always talk about the past while the ones running with you are talking about the future. It’s not about the race it’s about the training for the race. item.title: 184: R.I.C.E. - Rest, Ice, Compression, Elevate
item.description:
How many risks have you taken in 2019? How many risks have you taken in your life? Earlier this year Karl took some time to figure out what he wanted his life to look like outside of ETA and in 6 months he’s changed the trajectory of his life and his families life. ET and CJ interview Karl to get the blueprint on what he did to go from living a good life to living a phenomenal life. Karl emphasizes that if you truly desire to live a certain way and to have certain things you can make it a reality. Ask yourself today what is it that you really want and are you willing to work for it? item.title: Eps. 183 - Mile High Club
item.description:
Negativity. It’s something that we can’t get away from. But how do you handle it? How do you deal with people saying your product isn’t good enough? How do you deal with people telling you you’re not doing a good job? Do you let it affect you in a manner that makes you want to quit? On today’s podcast, the guys talk about the impact of negativity. They give insight on how they deal with it now and how they’ve dealt with it in the past before success. None of us are exempt from hearing negative comments and criticism but we all have to learn how to react to it. Time Stamped Topics: [02:24] - Trey’s Comedy Corner [06:54] - Negative Feedback [23:35] - Comparison Theory [39:50] - Managing Negativity [50:00] - Getting Under ET’s Skin [53:00] - Tobe Get’s Trolled [1:04:22] - Ask ET [1:38:42] - Nugget of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Get fresh pre-measured ingredients delivered straight to your door. Get $80 off your first month by using the promo code “SUCCESS80”
Turn your passion into a profit with ETA’S certified speaking program. Visit www.etagamechangers.com. The Secrets to Success: @S2SPodcast on IG You have to have a stronger voice than the voice in your head. Keeping the vision of what’s ahead of you will cost you your next opportunity. The impact of finishing is greater than the excitement of starting. There’s a group of people that need you more than you need to listen to negative comments. You’ll get more accomplished living out your purpose than being allured by someone’s negative comments. ET Events: Phenomenal Life 2020

item.title: Eps. 179 - The Frugal Preacher
item.description:
If you’ve tried to improve any aspect of your life you’ve encountered failure. Some of you have experienced failure more than others and because of that, you’ve given up completely. On today’s podcast, ET talks about the mindset it takes to experience failure and make the decision to not give up. Often people are concerned with what you have to do to become successful but ET explains why it’s more important to understand what it takes mentally. item.title: Eps. 177 - Ugly Instagram
item.description: Doing the work vs looking like you’re doing the work. Today’s podcast talks about the difference between the two. In today’s world of social media, it’s easier to LOOK like you’re doing the working instead of actually doing the work. In order to be successful, you have to actually do the work as well as go through a process. The guys discuss the importance of not being influenced or discouraged by what you see on social media and instead focus on the work. Obtaining real success requires REAL work in the lab and not LIKES on Instagram. item.title: Eps. 175 - Tobe's Turn
item.description: Today’s podcast features Tobe Nwigwe as he shares his journey on how’s he’s been able to achieve an incredible level of stardom. The theme for today’s show is “Take The Stairs”. Many people want to obtain success and keep it, but they believe there is a shortcut. A myth that Tobe denounces. This conversation is for anyone who’s trying to build something from the ground up. The underlying theme of today’s episode is to be consistent with your gift/skillset, grab your pens and pads, get ready to take notes. Time Stamped Topics: [03:37] - Tobe Nwigwe [18:28] - The Steps [23:19] - So Gone Challenge [31:00] - Parental Support [41:24] - Biggest Misconceptions [47:30] - Tour Life [1:00:00] - I’m Not a Unicorn [1:20:00] - Stay With It Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. The Secrets to Success: @S2SPodcast on IG People want to be a part of a ship that’s already moving. You ain’t gotta be sweet just be consistent. Consistency is the ultimate KEY. item.title: Eps. 173 - Po'Boy
item.description:
This week on the podcast the guy’s are fresh off the road from the 1% workshop in Dallas. A workshop designed to help individuals live a life of abundance versus a life of lack. During the workshop Karl had his shining moment on stage and received a standing ovation for his presentation. This moment led to a conversation on how and when does someone make a turning point in their life. Many of you listen to this podcast weekly but you still haven’t made the turning point that will change your life. Grab your pen and pad and take notes so you can start taking the steps needed today. Time Stamped Topics: [05:35] - CJ Don’t Want to Talk [13:09] - Fair or Foul [27:00] - Karl’s Moment [42:00] - The Turning Point [54:25] - Quiet The Noise [1:20:24] - Ask ET [1:30:00] - Nugget of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Get fresh premeasured ingredients delivered straight to your door. Get $80 off your first month by using the promo code “SUCCESS80”
Become a paid speaker with ETA’s Game Changer program www.etagamechangers.com
The Secrets to Success: The Passport Personality Assessment www.etinspires.com/assessment
You aren’t growing because you’re worried about what the wrong people think. The beautiful thing about discipline is that you choose what to sacrifice. Don’t allow people to give you second-hand fear. ET Events:

item.title: Eps. 171 - Born Again
item.description:
Can you bounce back? On today’s podcast, the guys hone in on the Virginia Men’ Basketball Team who recently won the National Championship. A year prior they were the laughing stock of the NCAA as they lost to a 16 seed while being the number 1 seed. To translate this into real life think about a year or an instance where you felt like you messed up so bad that you couldn’t bounce back. You’re embarrassed, people are talking about it, what did you do? Did you fold or did you get ready for the next season? Listen to hear what ET says you should after experiencing a BIG Loss. Time Stamped Topics: [03:00] - NCAA Update [06:38] - Fair or Foul [22:00] - ET No Phone! [41:21] - ET Go Off! [54:30] - Virginia [1:08:00] - Confidence factor [1:19:40] - Ask ET Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Become a paid speaker with ETA’s Game Changer program www.etagamechangers.com
The Secrets to Success: The Passport Personality Assessment www.etinspires.com/assessment
When you’re down you can either make it your reality or you can say you’re in transition. If you make a decision NOT to quit you will begin to experience favor in a way you’ve never experienced before. We must prove to ourselves that we are who we say we are. The full circle of life is to know what it’s like to lose and to know what it’s like to win. You will never be a winner if you quit and give up. ET Events:
1% Chicago April 26, 2019
1% Dallas April 19, 2019 SOLD OUT

item.title: Eps. 170 - Izzo's Revenge
item.description:
How much do you believe in yourself? Like really believe in yourself. Or do you think once you get another degree you’ll be good, or another certification or a co-sign that makes you believe in yourself? On today’s podcast, ET asks listeners what’s your road to the Final Four? Sometimes we think because we don’t have the ideal circumstances that we can’t beat the odds and come out on top. The road to the Final Four will not be paved straight but the guys talk about why you can still win a championship, despite what number seed you’re given.
Time Stamped Topics: [03:38] - Delta Beef [09:14] - Confidence Wins [19:53] - Athlete Impact [26:40] - Being Stuck vs Stagnant [45:00] - Punch Back [1:05:20] - Share the Stage Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. The Secrets to Success: The Passport Personality Assessment www.etinspires.com/assessment
You’re not stuck, you’re in learning mode. 9 times out of 10 you’re stuck because you’re focused on the things you can’t control. Perfection is NOT the price of admission. ET Events:
1% Chicago April 26, 2019
1% Dallas April 19, 2019

item.title: Eps. 166 - Shot Down....Woke Up
item.description:
Everyone experiences pain in their life. But there are a lot of people who carry their pain daily as well as blame everything in their life on that pain. Some of you have the pain of a failed marriage, maybe you had a terrible childhood, and some of you may have issues with your parents. Today the guys discuss how and why you have to move on past your pain in order to live the life you deserve. ET gives listeners 5 things to think about in order to move past the pain and put themselves in a better position. Time Stamped Topics: [03:24] - Post Jamaica Blues [08:14] - Fair or Foul [18:43] - Jorge Story [33:57] - Everyone’s A Victim [42:30] - Personal Accountability [59:57] - Nugget of The Day [63:22] - Stop The Bleeding Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. The Secrets to Success: The Passport Personality Assessment www.etinspires.com/assessment
Once you acknowledge that you’re the enemy you give yourself the power to do something about it. The minute you say it’s someone else's fault you give them control of your destiny. When you operate on an excellent level you get a certain level of freedom. ET Events:
1% Chicago April 26, 2019
1% Dallas April 19, 2019
Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embodies the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. Subscribe to the podcast via Apple Podcasts.

item.title: Eps. 165 - I'm Money
item.description:
This week the guys are recording the podcast live from Jamaica from the Phenomenal Life event and are in company with financial expert Rob Wilson. How many of you have money problems? Lack of income, savings, or just not knowing what to do with the money you have. Rob Wilson breaks down why money is in fact VERY important in your life and how to use it to your advantage. Be prepared to walk away from today’s podcast with a plan for your wealth and the rest of your life. Time Stamped Topics: [1:55] - Fair or Foul [17:30] - When To Splurge [25:17] - Living For Now [41:00] - Everyone is A Business Owner [55:26] - I’m Doing Well [1:08:19] - Nugget of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. The Secrets to Success: The Passport Personality Assessment www.etinspires.com/assessment
Money is the second most important thing in your life. If people realize who they were and that you don’t have to make money but you are money. Most people when left to your own devices will not make good choices for themselves. Everywhere has problems but everywhere doesn’t have the same opportunities. ET Events:
1% Chicago April 26, 2019
1% Dallas April 19, 2019

item.title: Eps. 164 - Pillow Power
item.description:
Keeping up with the joneses. A term we’ve all heard before and the topic of the podcast today. Have you ever wanted something because someone else has it? Or have you ever thought that because you were making a certain amount of money you were obligated to go and buy the latest designers? The guys dive deep into what the real motivating factor is behind making certain purchases or wanting certain things. Be prepared to assess your own intentions behind all the things you want to obtain. Time Stamped Topics: [16:00] - Avery runs the show [23:15] - Money Relationship [37:35] - Keeping Up [54:00] - Wealth-vs-Money [1:13:00] - Be Yourself [1:21:23] - Ask ET [1:37:12] - Nugget of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Hello Fresh is giving our listeners $60 off your first three deliveries just visit www.hellofresh.com/success60 and enter the promo code “SUCCESS60” The Secrets to Success: The Passport Personality Assessment www.etinspires.com/assessment
Money is not wealth, you’re short sided if you think it is. Wealth means you’re balling in every category. You’re broke because you’re trying to do something someone else does the exact way they do it. Comparison is the thief of joy. ET Events:
Phenomenal Life Jamaica February 25 - March 3, 2019
1% Chicago April 26, 2019
1% Dallas April 19, 2019 Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embodies the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. Subscribe to the podcast via Apple Podcasts.

item.title: Eps. 161 - Last Guys Finish Last
item.description:
In 2019 ET is on a quest to study what it takes to really be able to execute at a high level. On today’s podcast, he brings a case study involving effort -vs- execution. A lot of people think that they’re effort is enough to get them to the next level. Specifically good people who try hard but just aren’t performing at a level they need to perform at. ET and the squad explain to us why effort is sometimes rewarded but execution is worshipped. Time Stamped Topics: [05:30] - Karl Snowed In [17:48] - iPhone Glitch [23:12] - Publix Singer [25:43] - Case Study [39:25] - Naiviety [46:14] - Do nice guys finish last? Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. The Secrets to Success: The Passport Personality Assessment www.etinspires.com/assessment
Plan 2 Prosper Journal Stop assuming the business world is full of people who have good intentions. ET Events:
Phenomenal Life Jamaica February 25 - March 3, 2019 Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embodies the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. Subscribe to the podcast via Apple Podcasts.
