item.title: Eps. 159 - Crack Chicken
item.description:
At one point do you keep trying something and give up on it? That’s the question that ET poses on today’s podcast. We all have areas in our life where we want to give up on something, or we have already given up. Relationships, business ventures, maybe even certain career choices. The guys carefully dissect how you should assess whether or not you should give up on anything that you’re seeking out. While listening to today’s podcast be sure to keep your current situation in perspective before you make a final decision to give up or keep going. Time Stamped Topics: [05:48] - Don’t switch what works [15:40] - Mr. Quinney update [20:00] - Family Matters [30:00] - When do you stop trying? [44:33] - Reprogram your thinking [53:00] - Why they didn’t quit [1:08:45] - Ask ET [1:23:00] - Nugget of the day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. The Secrets to Success: The Passport Personality Assessment www.etinspires.com/assessment
Plan 2 Prosper Journal Don’t switch up what works. Pay attention to your indicators to decide whether or not you should move forward. The process is what’s deep not the goal. We look back at things with reverence but we look to the future with fear. ET Events:
Phenomenal Life Jamaica February 25 - March 3, 2019 Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embodies the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. Subscribe to the podcast via Apple Podcasts.

item.content:encoded:
At one point do you keep trying something and give up on it?  That’s the question that ET poses on today’s podcast. We all have areas in our life where we want to give up on something, or we have already given up. Relationships, business ventures, maybe even certain career choices. The guys carefully dissect how you should assess whether or not you should give up on anything that you’re seeking out. While listening to today’s podcast be sure to keep your current situation in perspective before you make a final decision to give up or keep going.

item.title: Eps. 155 - Flu Game
item.description:
On today’s podcast the guys talk about a characteristic that some of us struggle with. Confidence. How many of you are confident in your talents ? Confident in your abilities ? CJ notices that ET has been more confident this year than he’s been prior and on the flip side Karl admits to struggling with his own confidence. CJ steers the conversation in a way that will help listeners fix their confidence, while embracing their strengths and not focusing on their weaknesses. item.title: Eps. 154 - You Say He's Just A Friend
item.description:
If you’ve been listening to this podcast for a while then you’ve heard the guys talk about the inability to self-assess. A concept that they’ve taught and drilled into the heads of listeners and fans over the years. CJ realized that while they’ve been teaching others how to self-assess, they haven’t quite taught people how to fix things once they’ve done the self-assessment. The guys, along with Josh Hatch, give some very transparent personal examples on how they executed after self-assessing. Time Stamped Topics: [10:00] - Kids In The Real World [21:29] - Fair or Foul [25:00] - Fixing Yourself [36:00] - Accepting No Change [42:10] - Main Frame [52:00] - Who Are You ? item.title: Eps. 152 - The Yacht Club
item.description:
While on the road to success we often have a hard time balancing things. In particular the balance between being grateful for what you have and what you’ve accomplished you also desire and want more. This week on the podcast the guys talk about how to walk that fine line of being grateful yet not being satisfied. ET breaks down how he’s been able to stay focused on his original goal and not get caught up in wanting more for the wrong reasons. Time Stamped Topics: [03:50] - Tis The Season [11:40] - Petty Parent [18:40] - Balancing Act [38:00] - Set The Precedent [54:00] - Shifting Gears [1:15:50] - Ask ET [1:34:09] - Nugget of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. PayPal is your payments partner for today and tomorrow. Visit www.paypal.com/growth to set up your business account. The Secrets To Success: Your growth should be your own growth and not society’s growth. Your wants should only change in the scope of your own goals and dreams. The goal of going to the next level should not involve losing yourself. Don’t get to a point where you have your freedom yet you are a slave to what people think. Don’t live someone else’s dream because it may become a nightmare. ET Events:
Ignite The Dream Brooklyn, New York December 2, 2018 Spiritual Development Atlanta, Ga December 8, 2018
Phenomenal Life Jamaica February 25 - March 3, 2019 Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embodies the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. Subscribe to the podcast via Apple Podcasts.

item.title: Eps. 151 - Bosom Buddies
item.description:
Most people can’t get on because they’re too busy trying to get over. This was the statement that sparked the topic for today’s podcast. Many people have the tendency to overcharge people who they believe have money and can afford it. What they don’t understand is that the person with money knows they’re trying to get over and they are hurting themselves in the long run. ET gives listeners information on how to do business the right way by practicing mutualism and being honest and upfront in the beginning. item.title: Eps. 150 - Discount Double Check
item.description:
Most of us are born with gifts that we use every single day of our lives. Some of us are operating in those gifts professionally and some of us operate in our gifts as a hobby. I’m sure you’ve wondered when to charge for your gift and when you can use it for service ? I’m sure there are those of you who wonder if and when you should charge friends and family members. ET breaks down when and how to charge people for your services when you get to a professional level. item.title: Eps. 148 - The Miserable Millionaire
item.description:
If your a sports fan you know that recently the Boston Red Sox won the world series again. There’s an interesting fact that there is only one player on the team who was a part of the team the last time it won the World Series in 2013. What does that mean ? It means that being a part of a winning culture can be a game changer in your life. A winning culture can and will help you perform at your highest level if you welcome the challenge. Assess your culture of friends, mentors, and colleagues. Is it a culture that promotes greatness or a culture that helps you make excuses for being average ? item.title: Eps. 147 - Ms. Weed
item.description:
Pride and ego. Two characteristics that can hurt us and help us if used in the correct manner. On today’s podcast CJ brings an interesting experience with someone who asked for his opinion. The end resulted in the individual getting upset and letting their ego get in the way of not getting the coaching they needed. Has your ego ever prevented you from getting the information that you needed ? ET breaks down the difference between having pride and ego as well as how to, and who to, get input from. Time Stamped Topics: [05:30] - ET Quit [19:00] - Spiritual Development Recap [26:50] - Ego [31:40] - Pride vs Ego [1:02:00] - Recovering Liar [1:07:50] - Ask ET [1:10:00] - Nugget Of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. PayPal is your payments partner for today and tomorrow. Visit www.paypal.com/growth to set up your business account. Secrets To Success: People’s ego get so inflated that they can’t HEAR anything. There’s no way to grow if you’re not doing anything different. You should have a board of advisors to support you before you need their support. Don’t look for constructive criticism from people who haven’t constructed anything. ET Events:

item.title: Eps. 145 - Green Machine
item.description:
This week on the podcast ET takes over with what he thinks is wrong with people who want to blow up but haven’t yet. Most people won’t make as much money as they want because they aren’t able to solve problems. ET gives listeners 5 things to consider when it comes to problem solving and how you can use these things to be successful. Grab your pens and paper you will definitely need to take notes while listening to this episode. This week on the podcast the guys dive deep into the legacy of Chris Daniel. Chris Daniel introduced the Animal Assessment AKA The DISC Assessment to the ETA and Breathe University family. This assessment has changed the way that each of the guys communicates, do business, and build their relationships. They talk extensively about why you need to figure out your animal, study your animal, and then embrace it. If you haven’t already taken the assessment do so today by clicking here.

This week on the podcast the guys dive deep into the legacy of Chris Daniel. Chris Daniel introduced the Animal Assessment AKA The DISC Assessment to the ETA and Breathe University family. This assessment has changed the way that each of the guys communicates, do business, and build their relationships. They talk extensively about why you need to figure out your animal, study your animal, and then embrace it. If you haven’t already taken the assessment do so today by clicking here.

item.title: Eps. 142 - In Loving Memory of Chris Daniel
item.description: In life, there will always be people with their hands out looking for what they can get. What they can take for themselves without a thought for someone else. And, there are others who live their lives working to make the lives of others, better. Chris Daniel was that guy. When I tell you that Chris changed my life, E’s life, Karl’s life and everybody at ETA, Breathe University, Gamechangers and beyond, believe me, Chris’s life and example, made a difference! When Chris came onboard and introduced us all to his 4Animals personality assessment, he turned everything we thought we knew about ourselves upside down. Professionally, Chris was in a class all by himself. He was honestly, the best of the best of the best. Personally, he was no different. Chris was my dude. Just a solid human being, he went through enormous personal tragedy but bounced back, spending the rest of his life pouring into everyone he met and worked with. Chris believed in us, showed us, mad love, and by just being around him, hearing his critiques, watching him teach, seeing the passion he poured into every exchange whether he was in front of an audience or those moments backstage, or privately, he made us all stand up a little taller in everything we do. Chris was a friend who became my brother, and I am going to miss him terribly. That having been said, I will live the rest of my life in a way that best mirrors the life Chris taught me to live, and I would encourage you to do the same. Take inventory of your life. Make it right with whomever you have beef with. Don't waste another day building someone else's future without laying away things for the legacy you wish to leave behind. Be honest and live and love fully. Good night my friend. I'll see you in the morning. -CJ

item.title: Eps.139 - Hi-Jacked
item.description:
This week on the podcast the guys dive deep into the importance of investing in yourself. Have you found that you prefer things for “FREE” ? Are you the type of person who tries to figure out how to get something for “FREE” instead of paying ? ET calls it the shortcut mentality and he explains why this mentality does not work when you’re trying to be successful. Time Stamped Topics: [12:00] - Am I Tripping Or ? [15:30] - Does ET Need To Be Re-Baptized ? [35:08] - Invest in Yourself [55:15] - The Greats Work [1:11:00] - Fair or Foul [1:16:00] - Ask ET [1:26:57] - Nugget of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Grind Gear !! The gear that puts your grind in motion ! Use the code “S2S10” to save 10% on your next order. The Secrets to Success: Breakthroughs are harder than the struggle. You get more out of paying than when you get all the free stuff. You can’t give minimal effort and expect maximum results. There’s a level of passion you don’t experience when you don’t pay for something. ET Events:

item.title: Eps. 138 - Bounce The Bank
item.description:
This week on the podcast the guys discuss momentum. ET talks about how he got momentum in his current season. The importance of being intentional and deliberate plays a huge role in keeping your momentum once it’s started. Being intentional and deliberate helps you “create the rain”. If you aren’t picking up the steam you want in your life or business it’s time to create the momentum. Time Stamped Topics: [05:16] - Congrats Tobe ! [09:45] - Kindergarten Drop Off [24:00] - Above The Limit [37:43] - Momentum [53:41] - Losing Momentum [1:05:45] - Lowering Expectations [1:14:45] - Why You’re Average [1:25:22] - Nugget Of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Hello Fresh is giving our listeners $30 off your first week of deliveries just use the code “SUCCESS30” The Secrets to Success: Don’t wait for the momentum to go to the next level, take it to the next level. If you want to see momentum in your life you have to be intentional and deliberate. The dangerous thing about losing momentum is that it kills your confidence. Sometimes you have to use old momentum to kickstart the new momentum. ET Events:

item.title: Eps. 137 - What The Hail Is Going On ?
item.description:
How many of you out there are going after your dream and are flat out frustrated ? You’re doing the work and planting the seeds but you can’t see the crops. This week the guys talk about how hard it is to keep going when you have a dream but aren’t seeing the results. ET talks about how he fought through the hard days but ultimately he never doubted himself and the path he was on. What do you do when you get frustrated ? What do you do when you aren’t seeing the results ? Grab your pen and pad and listen to what ET did during his hard days. Time Stamped Topics: [09:16] - Fair or Foul [16:06] - Right or Wrong [26:39] - ET & The NBA [45:05] - How To Keep Going [53:26] - Quality of Grind [1:09:00] - Naivety & Faith [1:17:37] - Ask ET [1:32:30] - Nugget of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just go to www.organifi.com/success. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. The Secrets to Success: Sometimes it's not what you say it’s how you say it that’s more important than the information that’s being given. If you’re not leading then that means you’re being led. If you don’t have a plan for your life somebody got one for you. The grind has to come before the money. ET Events:

item.title: Eps. 136 - The Humble Preacher
item.description:
This week on the podcast ET talks about an experience he had over the weekend while traveling and speaking. The experience gave The Hip-Hop Preacher somewhat of a push and made me realize that no matter what you still have work to do. There is never a time where you don’t have to prove yourself and after you master one level there’s still another level to conquer. Listen as the guys talk about how these experiences keep him humble and how you should continue to improve your craft no matter what. item.title: Eps. 135 - The Movie Rental
item.description:
On today’s podcast the guys take a deep dive into ET’s success. How he got where he is ? How he managed to keep a high level of character on his run ? How he has managed to stay consistent and productive ? E talks about what he does on the days he may not be feeling it. Listen to today’s episode with a pen, paper, and an open mind as you learn a few more of ET’s Secrets To Success. item.title: Eps. 132 - White Estates
item.description:
Is the goal to win or to look like you’re winning ? On today’s podcast the guys talk about the effects of people displaying their “highlight reel” without putting in any real work behind it. We all know that social media plays a huge role in business and building a brand. The guys discuss the side effects of portraying like you’re doing something when you’re really not doing anything. Do yourself a favor and self assess what you’re posting and why you’re posting on social media. Are you posting it because it's really happening ? Or are you posting it to act like it's happening ? item.title: Eps 131 - Buttercake Confessions
item.description:
This week on the podcast the guys are joined with one of their favorite guests, Shawn Stevenson. Shawn joined the guys in St. Louis at the Take Control Conference and the guys knew he had to come back on the show. He talks intensively about energy and recovery and the importance of both. We often think we lose energy as we get older but Shawn provides some insight on where our energy actually comes from. He also shares some information on how to extend your lifespan, what the recovery process looks like for an entrepreneur, and how walking for just 11 mins a day can help you become healthier. Time Stamped Topics: [09:09] - Lebron Talk [20:47] - Energy Levels [36:53] - Role of Exercise [42:30] - Recovery For the Entrepreneur [52:30] - How Much Sugar ? [1:05:20] - People and Your Diet [1:16:00] - Ask Shawn [1:37:28] - Nugget of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Green Chef source wholesome, clean, sustainable ingredients of the highest quality and they are giving our listeners $50 off your first delivery just use the code greenchef.us/success. The Secrets To Success: “Energy isn’t something that you get it’s something you create.” “Nothing happens in a vacuum in your body.” “Every bit of food we eat is information.” “Our environment is set up based on money and not on our needs.” See ET Live:

item.title: Eps. 130 - Blame It On The Rain
item.description:
This week on the podcast the guys talk about the struggle of the triple double life. At the end of the day there are only so many hours in the day and sometimes you have to sacrifice something. How do you decide what to sacrifice ? How do you perform at a high level consistently ? ET argues that it’s easier to live the triple double life when you’re performing at a high level and that it’s hard when you’re average. Grab a pen and paper as you listen to today’s podcast and learn how to conquer the triple double life. item.title: Eps. 129 - Cover The Cage
item.description:
ET and the guys often talk about the importance of your environment. The importance of being around like minded individuals and making sure you have the right people in your circle. This week on the podcast they tackle the notion that says changing your circle makes you disloyal. What’s the balance ? Do you stay with your friends and not go to the next level ? Do you go to the next level and lose your friends ? ET stresses that you have to understand you have to give up something. You have to decide whether it will be certain relationships or the opportunity to become the greatest version of yourself. Which one will you choose ? Time Stamped Topics: [03:20] - Father’s Day Recap [07:28] - Lion of The Week [17:40] - Triple Double Detroit [42:35] - Loyalty [50:25] - ET’s Transition [1:08:20] - Walking The Balance [1:35:40] - The Nugget Of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Green Chef is proud to be USDA-certified organic. They source wholesome, clean, sustainable ingredients of the highest quality and they are giving our listeners $50 off your first delivery just use the code greenchef.us/success. The Secrets To Success: “When emotions are high, reasoning is low.” “If you’re in your feelings you’re going to get beat, if you’re in the principles you’ll get it.” See ET Live: June 24, 2018 Take Control St. Louis

item.title: Eps. 128 - Stop Complaining
item.description:
How many of you are in situations that you don’t like ? How many of you have circumstances that you aren’t in favor of ? On today’s podcast ET talks about individuals who don’t like where they are but who aren’t doing anything about it. There are things you can do to get better as a person, employee, and to get better in your craft. ET makes the claim that becoming better will give you the opportunity to have, be, and do what you want to do in life. Time Stamped Topics: [02:00] - Ring The Alarm [12:04] - What The Heck Was ET Trying To Say ? [23:36] - It’s A Bigger Issue [33:00] - Learn To Follow Through [49:00] - Becoming An Executor [1:00:00] - Full Execution [1:12:35] - Nugget Of The Day [1:20:35] - Fair or Foul Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Hello Fresh is giving our listeners $30 off your first week of deliveries just use the code “SUCCESS30” The Secrets To Success: “What are the things you have not done at this point that have not allowed you to be where you want to be ?” “What do I need to change to make myself better.” “The higher performer you are, the less crap you have to deal with.” “Everything you do should put you in a place to be something you aren’t.” See ET Live: June 24, 2018 Take Control St. Louis
July 14, 2018 Dreams 2 Legacy
September 1, 2018 Phenomenal Rally
February 25 - March 3, 2019 Phenomenal Life Jamaica

item.title: Eps. 124 - You Not My Mama
item.description:
This week on the podcast ET takes over the discussion and talks about living for other people. People doing things based on what they think someone else will think or how they will feel. CJ elaborates on the dangers of living with this mindset and how you can start to depend on other people to cosign for you and everything you do. They go on to talk about how this also creates a fixed mindset. This mindset will keep you from trying anything and eventually will keep you from growing and becoming the best version of yourself. Time Stamped Topics: [03:00] - Fair or Foul Recap [07:40] - Dede’s Fair or Foul [17:05] - Weekend Recap [31:10] - Do Things Right [40:00] - Use The Fear [1:00:19] - Fixed Mindset [1:10:40] - Ask ET [1:27:17] - Nugget Of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Hello Fresh is giving our listeners $30 off your first week of deliveries just use the code “SUCCESS30” The Secrets To Success: “Do not be weary in doing well.” “The worst thing in life to do is to go back and forth.” “It’s best to make a bad mistake than to not make a mistake at all.” “If you need a cheerleader or a co-signer for everything you’ll always be at the mercy of other people.” ET Events: May 20, 2018 Take Control Boston
June 24, 2018 Take Control St. Louis
February 25 - March 3, 2019 Phenomenal Life Jamaica

item.title: Eps. 121 - Sour Cream
item.description:
Today’s podcast is brought to you by ET being frustrated. Frustrated by individuals who have opportunities and aren’t capitalizing on them. ET has been all over the world and he’s recognized that people in certain countries do not have the same opportunities that we have in America. Despite what you may believe the opportunities here in American are more abundant than anywhere else in the world. ET is convinced that the majority of people are going to work but they do not want to work. The guys go over several different scenarios as to why and how people get this attitude. They also talk about how you can change your mindset and habits to become someone who performs at a high level in all opportunities. Time Stamped Topics: [02:00] - Weekend Round Up [06:39] - Fair or Foul [13:20] - Why You Can’t Blow Up [24:29] - The List [41:00] - 12 Year Boss Up [50:00] - The Pursuit of Happiness [1:02:00] - Mr. Nice Guy [1:16:00] - Ask Josh [1:33:45] - Nugget of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Hello Fresh is giving our listeners $30 off your first week of deliveries just use the code “SUCCESS30” The Secrets To Success: “Those of you going after money are already broke.” “If you don’t have a vision of what you want to do then have a vision of what you don’t want to do.” “You get a break by staying in the game long enough and doing the right stuff.” “Don’t add any stress when you get invited to the world of performers.” “Doing something because you think you can control the outcome is called an angle.” See ET Live: May 20, 2018 Take Control Boston
June 24, 2018 Take Control St. Louis
February 25 - March 3, 2019 Phenomenal Life Jamaica
Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embodies the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. Subscribe to the podcast via Apple Podcasts.

item.title: Eps. 120 - You Can't Have My Check
item.description:
Handouts and shortcuts, two words that the guys can’t stand ! This week on the podcast CJ goes off about one of his pet peeves. People asking for a handout or trying to take a short cut. You have a dream and you have a goal but you’re not willing to go through the fire to make it happen. The guys give tips on what to do and what not to do while trying to blow up, how to reach out to high profile people for an opportunity, and what absolutely NOT to do to try to get traction in your business. Keep in mind that there are NO shortcuts and NO handouts. Time Stamped Topics: [09:20] - No shortcut [18:40] - ET Going Gorilla [32:47] - You Can’t Have My Check [46:28] - Show Your Work [56:50] - Ask ET [1:20:00] - Nugget of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Hello Fresh is giving our listeners $30 off your first week of deliveries just use the code “SUCCESS30” The Secrets To Success: “Invited guests are welcomed best.” “Excellence attracts excellence.” “When people are happy their productivity isn’t the same.” “Nothing too soon is a blessing.” “Success has an equation and you have to follow the equation and show your work.” See ET Live: May 20, 2018 Take Control Boston
June 24, 2018 Take Control St. Louis
February 25 - March 3, 2019 Phenomenal Life Jamaica
Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embodies the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. Subscribe to the podcast via Apple Podcasts.

item.title: EPS. 117 - Reverse Layup
item.description:
By the time you hear this I’m sure you’ll know that Loyola has made it to the Final Four. Loyola is a college basketball team that ET has been working with all year. The guys talk extensively on what it took for them to get there. The mindset, the work ethic, and the amount of faith they have in themselves. Although all three of those things were important CJ pointed out that one thing these guys did consistently, in every game, was make their reverse layups. It’s what they are good at, it’s their super power if you will. Karl then poses the question “What’s your reverse lay up ?” Hopefully after today’s episode you’ll figure yours out. Time Stamped Topics: [02:17] - Fair or Foul [06:15] - The Underdogs [21:20] - The Special Ingredient [36:45] - ETA Is Still A Underdog [56:00] - Ask ET [1:20:00] - Nugget of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Health IQ is an insurance agency for the healthy conscious individual. To see if you qualify for up to 25.5% off of your life insurance visit www.healthiq.com/success. Gems From The Podcast: “Don’t look at an opportunity based on size.” “Sometimes the blessings you’re looking for aren’t coming from where you think they’re coming from.” “You need every personality around you to be great.” “Don’t scout your identity out of the process.” See ET Live: May 20, 2018 Take Control Boston
June 24, 2018 Take Control St. Louis

item.title: Eps. 116 - Second Hand Screaming
item.description:
On this week’s podcast the 3 Amigo’s are back together again and they’re talking about giving. Is it hard for you to give ? Do you believe that if you give it will be given back to you ? CJ poses the question to ET in regards to how it’s so easy for him to give without thinking twice about it. The answer to his question isn’t based on the amount of money in your bank account it’s a mindset and the guys are going to teach you how to get a giver’s mindset. Time Stamped Topics: [03:20] - Fair or Foul [26:30] - Negative Feedback [37:00] - Don’t Be Tight [57:02] - Foreign Concept [1:03:35] - Back In The Day [1:13:21] - Ask ET [1:28:10] - Nugget of the Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Health IQ is an insurance agency for the healthy conscious individual. To see if you qualify for up to 25.5% off of your life insurance visit www.healthiq.com/success. Gems From The Podcast: “Get around other givers.” “If all you have to give is money then you’re already broke.” “It’s hard to be depressed when you’re looking out for people.” See ET Live: May 20, 2018 Take Control Boston
Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embodies the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. Subscribe to the podcast via Apple Podcasts.

item.title: Eps. 114 - The Rabbit Hole
item.description:
This week’s podcast was live from the Phenomenal Life Cruise. ET kicks off the conversation by asking a question about balance. How do you find the balance between family responsibilities and going after a dream ? The guys talk extensively about why balance is so important while chasing a dream and having a family and how they deal with it. Well into the podcast the conversation transitions the difference between being a giver and a taker. The guys distinguish the difference between being a giver and a taker as well as the science behind being a TRUE giver. Time Stamped Topics: [07:00] - The Family Man [16:12] - What is the balance ? [34:20] - Order of operations [54:30] - It’s Levels [1:05:00] - Ask ET [1:13:00] - Nugget of the day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Hello Fresh is giving our listeners $30 off your first week of deliveries just use the code “SUCCESS30” Things To Think About: “Why are people in your circle if you’re not going to listen to them.” “If it’s not a check at the end of it or a friendship then you shouldn’t be on the phone.” “You grinding at your job and you’re bankrupt at home.” “Don’t do business with broke people and not just money.” See ET Live: March 18, 2018 Take Control Dallas, TX
May 20, 2018 Take Control Boston, Mas

item.title: Eps. 113 - Induced Insomnia
item.description:
How many of you have ideas that are literally stuck in your head ? You have a gift or a talent but you never take the time to really focus on operating in that gift. Instead you continue to do work you hate every single day because it’s the safe thing to do. The guys this week discuss this complex and what really happens when people fail to make the decision to start. Why are people afraid to start ? Why are they afraid to fail ? The guys, along with Josh, discuss what’s real and what’s fake when it comes to taking the leap of faith and going after your dreams. Time Stamped Topics: [02:10] - ET on TV [11:00] - Jalin & ETA [26:12] - When Is It Time To Start ? [37:17] - Why Think Negative ? [55:28] - When Things Are Not Going Right [1:03:40] - Lessons Learned [1:07:10] - Hey Josh ! Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Health IQ is an insurance agency for the healthy conscious individual. To see if you qualify for up to 25.5% off of your life insurance visit www.healthiq.com/success. Gems From The Podcast: “When you’re a champion you understand there’s wins and losses.” “Stop waiting to make the right decision, make a decision and make it right.” “The longer you sit and wait the more you start to talk yourself out of it.” “It takes more energy to focus on failure.” “If you’re going to take a risk take a risk on you.” “You can’t lose when you’re learning.” “There’s one sure fire way to win when you make that decision is to move and move fast.” “Turn the pressure into something positive.” “Pressure is good, stress is NOT.” See ET Live: March 4-11th, 2018 Phenomenal Life Cruise
March 18, 2018 Take Control Dallas
May 20, 2018 Take Control Boston
Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embodies the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. Subscribe to the podcast via Apple Podcasts.

item.title: Eps. 112 - The Best Day of My Life
item.description:
This week’s podcast is full of valuable information and it’s spearheaded by Karl. Karl talks about how he’s made the decision to make every day THE BEST DAY OF HIS LIFE. After reviewing the book, “You Are A Badass”, Karl talks extensively about the power that we have. The power to think positively despite our circumstances, the power to focus on what’s important, and most importantly the power to change your life. Not change it next week, tomorrow, or next year, but the power to change it right now. He’s now challenging himself to 100 days of making every day the best day of his life. Are you willing to take the challenge with him ? Time Stamped Topics: [04:30] - Karl is Unleashed [18:36] - Own Your Life [29:45] - You Have The Power [50:00] - Ask Karl [1:07:39] - Karl’s Nugget of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Things To Think About: “Most people aren’t satisfied with where they are in life, but there is something you can do about it.” “As humans we look for events to make us happy.” “You have the power to change your focus over any situation in your life right now.” “Focus on your heartbeat and it will ease your pain.” See ET Live: February 25, 2018 Take Control Charlotte
March 4-11th, 2018 Phenomenal Life Cruise
March 18, 2018 Take Control Dallas
Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embodies the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. Subscribe to the podcast via Apple Podcasts.

item.title: Eps. 111 - The Insider
item.description:
This week on the podcast participants of the ETA Game Changers Speakers Program got a chance to be the live audience for the guys. The format was a bit different this week as CJ asked two Game Changers members to speak about their truth followed by a great Q & A session with the audience. Although different from the normal episodes this episode is still packed with value. The guys answer questions about what success means to them, when CJ told ET he had to become a household name, and what the true mission is for The School Days Foundation. Time Stamped Topics: [04:27] - Fair or Foul [12:17] - Your Truth vs The Truth [35:22] - Dreamers [49:23] - Live Q&A [1:24:30] - Volunteer First [1:32:00] - Nugget of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. RXBar is a whole food protein without fillers, additives, or sugars. Visit www.rxbar.com/success for 25% off your order. Just use the code SUCCESS at checkout. Things To Think About: “Your feelings are going to get you in trouble, the truth won’t.” “You seek out truth when you want to be in healthy wholesome relationships.” “You get in a funk when you don’t have a routine.” “Greatness doesn’t care about your color.” “Be rich in relationships.” See ET Live: February 25, 2018 Take Control Charlotte
March 4-11th, 2018 Phenomenal Life Cruise
March 18, 2018 Take Control Dallas

item.title: Eps. 110 - Cock-A-Doodle-Don't
item.description:
Have you ever found yourself scrolling on IG or facebook and wishing you had something someone else had ? Wishing you had the car, the house, or the relationship that someone else has. This week the guy’s talk about the dangers of comparing your life to someone else’s highlight reel. They explain that the dangers of doing this creates a false sense of happiness. Some people think that having a lot of money or success in their career will make them happy the guy’s explain why money and success doesn’t solve problems that you still will face. Time Stamped Topics: [08:40] - Am I Tripping Or ? [20:35] - Legendary E [37:10] - The Measuring Stick [53:40] - Afraid to Fail [1:04:19] - Ask ET [1:18:15] - Nugget of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Hello Fresh is giving our listeners $30 off your first week of deliveries just use the code “SUCCESS30” Things To Think About: “If you want to beat the champs you have to keep your foot on the gas.” “What are you comparing yourself to ?” See ET Live: February 10, 2018 Take Control Atlanta
February 25, 2019 Take Control Charlotte
March 4-11th, 2018 Phenomenal Life Cruise
March 18, 2018 Take Control Dallas
Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embodies the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. Subscribe to the podcast via Apple Podcasts

item.title: Eps. 109 - Bathroom Burglar
item.description:
Often times in business you’ll run into individuals who want to do business or may even be doing business, yet they don’t understand business. ET expresses his frustration with these individuals because what they don’t understand is the sacrifices that come with doing business. The guy’s pack this week’s podcast with plenty of insight on what it takes to truly to make a business successful. Karl talks about how there is never a perfect time to do anything, CJ chimes in on you should never put money ahead of the brand, and ET explains how your ignorance doesn’t allow you to see what it takes to truly be successful. Grab a pen and paper for this one, you’re going to need it. Time Stamped Topics: [02:30] - Karl In Barbados [08:45] - Fair or Foul [20:25] - ET Vents [36:45] - There Is No Perfect Moment [54:10] - Ignorance [1:16:30] - Ask ET [1:20:45] - Nugget of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Things To Think About: “It is the failure that makes you better.” “If you present yourself as perfect you have a problem.” “Don’t wait for the perfect moment, take the moment and make it perfect.” Book Recommendation: Shoe Dog By: Phil Knight See ET Live: February 4, 2018 Take Control Miami

item.title: Eps. 108 - You Dip, I Dip, We Dip !
item.description:
On this week’s podcast the 4th Amigo Josh Hatch joins the guys again and it doesn’t take long for the guy’s to go deep. We all know the Patriots are returning to the Super Bowl but what is it about this organization that makes them so special. How do they take players that nobody wants and turn them into champions ? Josh calls it the underdog culture. The culture and attitude of believing that no matter what you always have something to prove. The second half of the show ET talks about encountering what he calls a pack of gazelle’s. Listen closely to the lessons that ET gives based off of his experience with two people who were not ready for an opportunity of a lifetime. Time Stamped Topics: [02:00] - Am I Tripping Or ? [05:15] - Patriots Win Again [30:00] - The Difference [36:44] - A Pack of Gazelle’s [54:12] - You Can’t Deposit Likes [1:06:01] - Ask ET [1:28:10] - Nugget of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Things To Think About: “The hand you get, you gotta play that hand and better hand will come to you at some point.” “Stop looking for the system and become the person that someone wants to recruit.” “If you can’t get yourself going in a good routine you can’t get to the next level.” “Why have a craft if you’re not going to give it 120%.” See ET Live: February 4, 2018 Take Control Miami

item.title: Eps. 107 - Dirty Santa Drive
item.description:
It’s a brand new year and everyone is pumped up with their new year’s resolutions and goals. Unfortunately most people will quit before february gets here. In today’s episode CJ ask ET how he sticks with his routine and how he keeps it going. ET reminds us that the most important thing we can do to hit our goals is to begin doing something that we can sustain. Doing something that you can sustain creates consistency and will get you to your goals and you’ll see results. Be sure to listen to the entire episode as the guys gives you a sneak peek of their Breathe University Mastermind Sunday Call that featured podcast guest Jamal King. For more information on joining Breathe University visit the website. Time Stamped Topics: [03:40] - Make A Decision [16:29] - Lion/Gazelle of The Week [23:51] - Fair or Foul [37:29] - The ET Routine [50:41] - Selected Discipline [59:00] - Ask ET [1:22:00] - Nugget of The Day Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Casper is the best bed for better sleep. Award-winning mattresses and sleep products for your best rest. Use our code STS to get $50 off select mattresses. Things To Think About: “Don’t get mad at me dancing cause you don’t hear the music.” “Discipline kicks in when motivation wears off.” “Just becomes something isn’t automatic doesn’t mean it doesn’t exist.” “Take the risk or lose the chance.” See ET Live: February 4, 2018 Take Control Miami

item.title: Eps. 106 - Jordan & Pippen
item.description:
This week on the podcast things are a little different. CJ sits down and interviews ET one on one in the legendary Patchwerk Studios. CJ wanted to sit down with E and ask him the questions that people don’t ask him. ET shares some incredible moments that helped him solidify his calling as a speaker. For the first time he also opens up about his faith and how his relationship with God has gotten him to where he is today. Prepare to take notes as ET talks about things that he’s never spoke about before. item.title: Eps. 105 - Stop, Drop, and Roll
item.description:
This week on the podcast the guys are back from celebrating the holiday season with a special guest. Jamal King who’s had dreams of being a millionaire since he was a kid. Jamal tells his story of growing up in Chicago in a blue collar family. His story starts with him becoming a Chicago cop to now a successful entrepreneur who’s made his dreams of being a millionaire come true. One of the key things Jamal mentions is that his exposure to a different way of life is what allowed him to believe he can obtain it. Whatever your vision is for your life find a way to get exposed to it. item.title: Eps. 103 - Dirty Santa
item.description:
At some point in life we all face an adversity. Whether it’s at home, school, or work you’ve ran into an adverse situation. Now think about that moment and how you reacted to it. Were you calm or were you angry ? Have you ever noticed yourself going off in situations where it wasn’t necessary ? In today’s podcast the guys discuss the difference between people who handle adverse situations differently. The people who go off in situations instead of people who stay calm. ET talks about how he discovered his triggers when he does go off. He gives tips on how to find your own triggers. One of the most important tips ET gives is asking yourself “What’s the goal”. As you run into adverse situations today, tomorrow, and for the rest of your life, stop and ask yourself “What is the goal”. Time Stamped Topics: [09:54] - Fair or Foul [18:40] - CJ Almost Ruined Christmas [26:40] - Handling Adverse Situations [41:00] - ET Says No to A Picture [1:08:50] - Ask ET [1:33:22] - Nugget of The Day Things To Think About: “If you’re going to get different outcomes you have to do something different.” “The way some people respond to situations is cultural.” “Immediately before going off ask yourself what’s the goal.” Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Hello Fresh is giving our listeners $30 off your first week of deliveries just use the code “SUCCESS30” See ET Live: March 2018 Phenomenal Life Cruise

item.title: Ep. 102 - Belt On A Shelf
item.description:
If you’ve been following ET for a while you know what he preaches. Go beast mode, never give less than 120%, and outwork the competition. But what happens when you apply those principles to work and not to your family. Have you found yourself going 120 at work and going on cruise control at home ? This week’s podcast the guys talk about how to balance it all. The truth is there will ALWAYS be something going on. Especially when you’re chasing a dream and building a business. The key is to prioritize things to make sure you never leave your family out of the equation. item.title: Eps. 100 - You Can't Tell Me Nothing
item.description:
Whenever you set goals and dreams you realize there are certain things you have to do and have to reach them. You have to be disciplined, consistent, and most importantly you need accountability. On today’s episode the guys talk intensively about the importance of accountability. Why you need accountability ? How to find the right accountability partners ? What does it mean when you reject accountability ? All of the answers to these questions and more on today’s episode. Time Stamped Topics: [03:00] - Thanksgiving Recap [14:00] - Accountability [34:00] - How to receive critique [44:20] - Ulterior Motives [1:20:00] - Ask ET [1:36:46] - Nugget Of The Day Things To Think About: “Don’t put yourself in an environment of accountability if you’re not ready to receive it.” “There is no accountability when you’re doing it by yourself.” Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. See ET Live: March 2018 Phenomenal Life Cruise

item.title: Eps.99 - Old Wives Tale
item.description:
This week’s podcast the guys welcome two special guests. Cj’s wife Candis and ET’s wife Dede joined the podcast to bring a new take on things. Dede starts it off by letting the guys know what she’s NOT thankful for when it comes to the guys and their relationships with each other. The show then transitions into a more serious note as CJ asks Dede about the impact of ET’s celebrity and why she even chose ET while he was homeless. The ladies bring an interesting perspective to the podcast that all listeners will appreciate. Time Stamped Topics: [03:55] - Fair or Foul [09:30] - What Dede is NOT thankful for [28:06] - Shake it Up or Sit Back [32:40] - Why Dede chose ET ? [55:00] - When do you quit ? [1:07:14] - Silent Treatment [1:35:12] - Marriage Tips [1:40:00] - Nugget of The Day Things To Think About: “Good things take time.” “In a marriage opposite is good.” “What you put out in the world is what you attract.” “Don’t be blinded by your goals and dreams that you forget about the nuts and bolts.” Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. item.title: Eps 98 - Hit and Run
item.description:
In life we all have one common goal and that’s to be happy. But what is happiness ? How do you become happy ? Once you become happy how do you stay happy ? Happiness is defined differently based on each person’s preference. The guys get together this week to discuss the pursuit of happiness and what happiness means to each of them. Ken joins the podcast to speak about how on his pursuit of happiness he’s run into fear. After listening to this episode take some time to assess your life and figure out what it is that really makes you happy. What are some things that you are afraid of that are keeping you from being happy ? Dream happiness, pursue happiness, and leave the fear behind. Time Stamped Topics: [03:16] - LA Recap [09:40] - Fair or Foul [14:16] - Defining happiness [31:00] - Getting past fear [56:00] - Components of life [1:17:14] - When are you at your happiness ? [1:32:00] - Ask ET [1:47:40] - Nugget of the day Things To Think About: “The fear comes in not believing in your ability to produce something.” “Fear leads to paralysis.” Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. See ET Live: March 2018 Phenomenal Life Cruise
Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embodies the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. Subscribe to the podcast via Apple Podcasts

item.title: Eps. 97 - Forgive the Unforgivable
item.description:
Often times you hear people say you should forgive those who wrong you or hurt you. It may be a parent, a sibling, or even a friend. This week the guys talk about the importance of forgiving people and repairing relationships. Holding on to anger in your heart hurts you and not the other individual. The danger that comes with not forgiving someone can last a lifetime and can affect your spouse, your kids, and future relationships. You have to find a way to heal and forgive. Listen to the guys talk about how healing and forgiving has impacted their lives and the lives of their loved ones. This week’s episode is dedicated to CJ’s father in law James Haller Jr.. May he rest in peace. Time Stamped Topics: [03:18] - Fair or Foul [13:00] - Tragedy Strikes [26:20] - Repairing Relationships [39:40] - Removing the Cancer [55:00] - Stay Ready [1:09:00] - Nugget of The Day Things To Think About: “The people who are the closest to you are the people who get hurt by you.” Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. Hello Fresh Meal Kit delivery service is offering our listeners $30 off their first week of service. Use code “SUCCESS30” while checking out to take advantage of this offer. See ET Live: November 12, 2017 Los Angeles, CA Stay Ready Conference

item.title: Eps. 96 - The Consistency Hack
item.description:
Everyone wants to win the game winner, hit the home run, or make a BIG impact in some way. All of those things are great but we forget about the small consistent things that it takes to make these things happen. On this week’s podcast the guys dive deep into the importance of consistency and how it will change your life. By the end of this episode you will understand that the real hack to becoming successful in life is to be consistent. item.title: Eps. 95 - A King's Return
item.description:
Sometimes in life you get treated unfairly and people will spit venom on your name. The natural reaction would be to retaliate. In today’s episode you will learn why retaliation is in fact not the best option. Last week ET returned back to his alma mater Oakwood University to speak. ET has written and spoken about Oakwood in many books and speeches but he’s never mentioned that he was banned from speaking on campus. That is until last week when he returned. In this episode you will learn why handling things with dignity is the absolute best thing to do no matter how bad a situation is. Time Stamped Topics: [10:06] - What Would You Do ? [18:20] - Fair or Foul ? [24:15] - Challenge With the 100 Day Challenge [31:38] - ET Goes Back To Oakwood [1:00:00] - Old Regime Meets New Regime [1:19:35] - Ask ET [1:30:00] - Nugget Of The Day Things To Think About: “Anything you get locked in on will require sacrifice.” “You can’t justify retaliation.” “If you think you can’t do it it’s probably because you’re doing it alone.” “Don’t become the thing you hate” "Nothing is permanent but change." Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. See ET Live: October 29 Chicago, IL Take Control Entrepreneurship Series
November 12 Los Angeles, CA Stay Ready Conference

item.title: Eps. 94 - Gassed Up
item.description:
On today’s podcast the guys are speaking directly to current and aspiring entrepreneurs. Josh Hatch joins the podcast and gives an incredible amount of insight regarding attracting high level talent, starting multi-million dollar companies, and what it takes to succeed as an entrepreneur. This business Q & A episode is going to have current and aspiring entrepreneurs re-evaluating everything from its mission statements to its systems. One of the key points in this episode is to make sure you’re finding and filling the gaps in your industry. Figure out what other people aren’t willing to do that will set you apart. Grab your pen and pad and take a seat in this business class. Time Stamped Topics: [01:43] - Am I Tripping Or ? [12:00] - Business Q&A w/Josh [27:30] - Recruiting Great Talent [55:00] - Going The Extra Mile [1:06:15] - Robin Hood [1:36:00] - Nugget of The Day Things To Think About: “More revenue and more people does not mean more profits.” “A part of winning is not just being talented, it’s having a system.” “Don’t look to be next level until you get your system.” “You have to stay in business long enough to find the gaps.” Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. See ET Live: October 29 Chicago, IL Take Control Entrepreneurship Series
November 12 Los Angeles, CA Stay Ready Conference
March 2018 Phenomenal Life Cruise

item.title: Tuesday Power Up / Shape Don't Be Shaped
item.description:
There are those of you out there who go through life doing what others want you to do instead of what you want to do. You go to college and get degrees you don’t want. You get jobs in fields you have no interest in. It’s time to stop being what everyone else wants you to be. It’s not about what your mom wants, what your coach wants, or your significant other. This is your life and you are responsible for shaping it the way you want it to be. Starting today shape and don't be shaped. Thank you so much for listening to this episode of Tuesday's Power Up episode. If you haven’t done so already, please take a minute and leave a quick rating and review of the show in iTunes . See ET Live: Chicago, IL October 29 Take Control Entrepreneurship Series

item.title: Eps. 93 - Love Conquers
item.description:
The guys are back from a fun filled week active week and the topic is LOVE. Specifically Love Conquers, which is the latest viral video from ET. After the tragic event in Las Vegas ET gave a powerful speech during his weekly Success Series event. On the podcast ET talks about what it feels like to deliver a powerful speech such as that one and he speaks about how and why you should practice love. The guys also transition into talking about the importance of going through a tough season and how it shapes you. Grab a friend or family member who may be going through a tough time to listen to this episode. If you haven’t seen the Love Conquers video yet do so now. item.title: Tuesday Power Up / Best or Nothing
item.description:
There are those of you who out there who only give your best when it seems likes the “right opportunity”. You continue to only give 70% or 80% and you never go 120 all the time. I need you to stop that today and make a choice to be excellent everyday in all that you do. What you fail to realize is there is no other way to greatness except giving 120% effort at all times. From this day forward I need you to give your best or nothing !! “Whatever your hand find to do, do with ALL your might.” See ET Live: October 29 Chicago, IL Take Control Entrepreneurship Series
November 12 Los Angeles, CA Stay Ready Conference
March 2018 Phenomenal Life Cruise
Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embodies the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. Subscribe to the podcast via Apple Podcasts

item.title: Eps. 92 - A PHD in Addiction
item.description:
This week on the podcast the guys have a brand new special guest. Dr. Adam Downs who is a specialist and thought leader on the subject of addiction and recovery. Dr. Downs took his first drink at the age of 10 and began smoking at 14. He talks about abusing prescription drugs as well as having a habit of drinking and smoking before and after school as a teen. As an adult he had a few stints with the law and even became clean for two years. Unfortunately he lost his grandfather his mom got sick and he relapsed. During this relapse Dr. Downs was sentenced to 10 years in prison and it changed his life. Dr. Downs is passionate about the subject of addiction and recovery and has dedicated his life to helping young adults overcome the issue. If you are or someone in your life is struggling with addiction reach out to Adam at adamd@bradfordhealth.net and visit www.bradfordhealth.net. Time Stamped Topics: [01:44] - Am I Tripping Or ? [09:52] - Gazelle of The Week [25:00] - Addiction [34:14] - Things Went Downhill [50:00] - How did this happen ? [1:05:00] - Building a new lifestyle [1:15:30] - Pushing the envelope [1:25:23] - Ask ET [1:42:30] - Nugget of The Day Things To Think About: “Do not over promise and under deliver.” “You have to be willing to try something different to see if you like the product.” “Stop focusing on why and how and instead focus on what.” Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. See ET Live: October 29 Chicago, IL Take Control Entrepreneurship Series
November 12 Los Angeles, CA Stay Ready Conference
March 2018 Phenomenal Life Cruise

item.itunes:subtitle: This week on the podcast the guys have a brand new special guest. Dr. Adam Downs who is a specialist and thought leader on the subject of addiction and recovery. Dr. Downs took his first drink at the age of 10 and began smoking at 14. He talks about...
item.itunes:summary:
This week on the podcast the guys have a brand new special guest. Dr. Adam Downs who is a specialist and thought leader on the subject of addiction and recovery. Dr. Downs took his first drink at the age of 10 and began smoking at 14. He talks about abusing prescription drugs as well as having a habit of drinking and smoking before and after school as a teen. As an adult he had a few stints with the law and even became clean for two years. Unfortunately he lost his grandfather his mom got sick and he relapsed. During this relapse Dr. Downs was sentenced to 10 years in prison and it changed his life. Dr. Downs is passionate about the subject of addiction and recovery and has dedicated his life to helping young adults overcome the issue. If you are or someone in your life is struggling with addiction reach out to Adam at adamd@bradfordhealth.net and visit www.bradfordhealth.net. Time Stamped Topics: [01:44] - Am I Tripping Or ? [09:52] - Gazelle of The Week [25:00] - Addiction [34:14] - Things Went Downhill [50:00] - How did this happen ? [1:05:00] - Building a new lifestyle [1:15:30] - Pushing the envelope [1:25:23] - Ask ET [1:42:30] - Nugget of The Day Things To Think About: “Do not over promise and under deliver.” “You have to be willing to try something different to see if you like the product.” “Stop focusing on why and how and instead focus on what.” Listener Perks: Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go. See ET Live: October 29 Chicago, IL Take Control Entrepreneurship Series
November 12 Los Angeles, CA Stay Ready Conference
March 2018 Phenomenal Life Cruise
item.content:encoded:
This week on the podcast the guys have a brand new special guest. Dr. Adam Downs who is a specialist and thought leader on the subject of addiction and recovery. Dr. Downs took his first drink at the age of 10 and began smoking at 14. He talks about abusing prescription drugs as well as having a habit of drinking and smoking before and after school as a teen.

As an adult he had a few stints with the law and even became clean for two years. Unfortunately he lost his grandfather his mom got sick and he relapsed. During this relapse Dr. Downs was sentenced to 10 years in prison and it changed his life. Dr. Downs is passionate about the subject of addiction and recovery and has dedicated his life to helping young adults overcome the issue.

If you are or someone in your life is struggling with addiction reach out to Adam at adamd@bradfordhealth.net and visit www.bradfordhealth.net.


Time Stamped Topics:

  • [01:44] - Am I Tripping Or ?
  • [09:52] - Gazelle of The Week
  • [25:00] - Addiction
  • [34:14] - Things Went Downhill
  • [50:00] - How did this happen ?
  • [1:05:00] - Building a new lifestyle
  • [1:15:30] - Pushing the envelope
  • [1:25:23] - Ask ET
  • [1:42:30] - Nugget of The Day


Things To Think About:

  • “Do not over promise and under deliver.”
  • “You have to be willing to try something different to see if you like the product.”
  • “Stop focusing on why and how and instead focus on what.”

item.title: Tuesday Power Up / Earn It
item.description: You’ve heard the saying “the best things in life are free”. In actuality the best things in life are things that are earned. People just don’t value things the same when they’re given to them. Things that they earn are treated with much more respect and care. Whatever you have in your life that you’re not earning take control today and start earning it. “You can’t make demands on something that you didn’t earn.” Thank you so much for listening to this episode of Tuesday's Power Up episode. If you haven’t done so already, please take a minute and leave a quick rating and review of the show in iTunes . See ET Live: Chicago, IL October 29 Take Control Entrepreneurship Series Los Angeles, CA November 12 Stay Ready LA Take your life to another level by joining us on the Phenomenal Life Cruise next March. See live tapings of the podcast and meet the entire squad. If you need to take your career or your marriage to the next level come out and join us in one or both of these cities.

item.title: Eps. 91 - Grandma's Gun
item.description:
We’re 13 days into the 100 Day Challenge and the guys are talking about how the challenge is going. While the challenge has been very impactful in all areas the guys specifically talk about how they’re being impacted in the family category. They also talk about the importance of building new habits and how doing things that are of high value will help you create the proper habits. Creating the right habits that will help you create a quality life and that is part of what the 100 Day Challenge is about. It’s not too late to join us just visit 100 Day Challenge With ET. item.title: Tuesday Power Up | Realistic Plans
item.description:
When setting goals we often set large goals or make plans that can be somewhat unrealistic. They may not be unrealistic as far as your ability but unrealistic when it comes to other factors that play a part in you making it happen. In order to avoid being disappointed by not doing what you said you were going to do, you have to learn what things will keep you from making it happen. Are there certain emotions that keep you distracted from the goal or the plan ? Are there certain environments that will keep you from achieving the goal or keeping the plan ? These are just two of many questions you need to ask yourself in order for you to set realistic plans. Be honest with yourself so that you can begin to set plans and goals that you can always execute and follow-through on. “Don’t plan to do things that are not realistic.” Thank you so much for listening to this episode of Tuesday's Power Up episode. If you haven’t done so already, please take a minute and leave a quick rating and review of the show in iTunes . See ET Live: Chicago, IL October 29 Take Control Entrepreneurship Series
Los Angeles, CA November 12 Stay Ready LA

item.title: Eps. 90 - The Hip Hop Hater
item.description:
In life everyone will go through a time where you will experience an extreme amount of negativity and even hate. It can be in your family, at your job, or even with some of your closest friends. These type of events often knock us off of our square and instead of focusing on our goals we focus on the haters. During this episode the guys discuss how they dealt with negativity in multiple areas. Listen to today's episode as ET gives several scenarios and tips on how to deal with hate. Very special shoutout to @DaNobleman for creating the Gazelle of The Week Jingle. Time Stamped Topics: [04:00] - Am I Tripping Or ? [21:30] - Negative Season [32:00] - Starve The Flu [44:40] - When is it time to go? [52:45] - Revenge [1:12:00] - Ask ET [1:27:00] - The Nugget of The Day 100 Day Challenge With ET Things To Think About: “You can’t talk about negativity without being impacted by it.” “Prior to dealing with hate you have to put yourself in a position where you have your own values.” “Don’t focus on the fever focus on getting well.” “Your success is the worst pain you’re haters will experience in life.” Listener Perks: Contact Wells Financial Legacy at 1-800-339-8034 for a FREE consultation with a credit specialist. Hello Fresh is giving our listeners $30 off your first week of deliveries just use the code “SUCCESS30” Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. item.title: Tuesday Power Up | PLAN
item.description:
Everybody has a dream and everybody has a goal. The problem is that no one has the proper plan to make the dream or goal happen. In order to achieve that thing you’re going after you have to put a strategic step by step plan together. You have to make the choice to wake up every day and work on that plan. The dream is great but the plan is what makes it happen and you have what it takes to get it done. “I will take control of my dream by planning.” Thank you so much for listening to this episode of Tuesday's Power Up episode. If you haven’t done so already, please take a minute and leave a quick rating and review of the show in iTunes . See ET Live: Chicago, IL October 29 Take Control Entrepreneurship Series

item.title: Eps. 89 - The Baby-Sitters Club
item.description:
The guy’s have another special guest on this week and it’s health guru Shawn Stevenson. Shawn is the host of "The Model Health Show" and today he answered some common health questions from listeners. Some of the important things he goes over are what the word organic actually means, why green leafy vegetables are important, and when you should check the scale. One of the most important things Shawn talks about is the impact of stress on our minds and bodies. Shawn gives an incredible amount of information on how to stay healthy inside and out. Be sure to check out the studies about sleep, flu shots, and stress. Time Stamped Topics: [03:27] - Gazelle of the week [10:00] - Fair or Foul [19:00] - “Real” Organic [34:00] - When to Check The Scale [1:00:00] - What is Stress ? Evening Routines That Enhance Sleep, Accelerate Fat Loss, And Supercharge Your Brain

item.content:encoded:
The guy’s have another special guest on this week and it’s health guru Shawn Stevenson. Shawn is the host of "The Model Health Show" and today he answered some common health questions from listeners. Some of the important things he goes over are what the word organic actually means, why green leafy vegetables are important, and when you should check the scale. One of the most important things Shawn talks about is the impact of stress on our minds and bodies. Shawn gives an incredible amount of information on how to stay healthy inside and out. Be sure to check out the studies about sleep, flu shots, and stress.

item.title: Eps. 88 - Dude, Where's My Car ?
item.description:
This week on the podcast the squad has a special guest. Financial Guru Rob Wilson joins the squad and the discussion is about money. The guys talk a lot about business and a key component in business is money. Rob goes over many different subjects regarding money including how much and how soon to save for your kid's college education, whether or not you should invest in the stock market, and how to deal with debt. Definitely, grab a pen and a pad while listening to this episode. It’s time to get your money right! item.title: Expansion
item.description:
It’s time to expand your territory. Expand means to become or make larger, or more extensive. Often times in life things seem to be good or even great and we don’t look for the opportunities to expand. You need to expand your territory and in order to do so you have to make that choice !! Make yourself aware of the fact that there are better things and opportunities available to you. Realize that expanding is something you can do be aware of what you need to do to make that happen. “Choose today to expand you and take you to the next level.” Thank you so much for listening to this episode of Tuesday's Power Up episode. If you haven’t done so already, please take a minute and leave a quick rating and review of the show in iTunes . See ET Live: November 12 Los Angeles, CA Stay Ready LA
Take your life to another level by joining us on the Phenomenal Life Cruise next March. See live tapings of the podcast and meet the entire squad. If you need to take your career or your marriage to the next level come out and join us in one or both of these cities. item.title: Eps. 87 - Risky Business
item.description:
As entrepreneurs it could be very tempting to take shortcuts and cut corners to get ahead. In business we learn that ethics and integrity are very important but we see a lot of individuals get ahead by cheating. CJ asks ET to explain how to avoid the temptation of cutting corners to get ahead. As complex as the question is ET gives us 2 great things to remember when doing business or when doing things for other people in general. Do things as if you’re doing it for yourself. Never build your house on sand because when the storm comes it will not last. Time Stamped Topics: [02:39] - Am I Tripping Or ? [11:00] - Integrity in Business [31:00] - ET Can’t Answer [43:46] - Explicit Knowledge [56:00] - Go Get The Blessing [1:10:11] - PTI ETA Style [1:18:20] - Ask ET [1:25:30] - Houston Nugget of The Day Things To Think About: “There are certain things you have to earn for yourself.” “When you give 120% the right way you will always have a job.” "When you cut corners you're killing something else that's inside of you." "Don't let your frustration make you stop, allow the frustration to help you keep going." Listener Perks: PayPal is offering our listeners $5,000 business loan with NO credit check. Additional terms and conditions apply please visit www.PayPal.com/success. Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go See ET Live: Washington, D.C. September 2 Stay Ready Conference

item.title: Own It!
item.description:
Opportunities will not come your way every single day. For some of you when the opportunities present themselves you get scared or you get nervous. You allow the lack of courage to sabotage the opportunity you have. When that opportunity comes you have to own it !! In order to do this you have to think differently about yourself. Listen to the affirmation at the end of this Power Up and repeat it daily in front of a mirror. It’s time for you to make the rest of your life the best of your life. “It’s time to become the person you’ve been destined to be and called to be.” Thank you so much for listening to this episode of Tuesday's Power Up episode. If you haven’t done so already, please take a minute and leave a quick rating and review of the show in iTunes . See ET Live: September 2 Washington D.C. Stay Ready Conference

item.title: Eps. 86 - Instagram Vegan
item.description:
The journey of entrepreneurship is not easy and as a small company things are even harder. In this episode the guys discuss the growing pains of ETA with a staff meeting amongst themselves. CJ and Karl give some great tips that entrepreneurs and small business owners need to be conscious of as well as some things that will help you stand out. Keep in mind that as a small business mistakes are going to be made and things are going to fall through the cracks. Just make the adjustments and never stop growing. Time Stamped Topics: [05:50] - Squad Phobias [33:00] - No longer the underdog [54:00] - Understand Your Customer [1:00:00] - Figure Out Your Advantages [1:20:00] - Ask ET [1:29:00] - Nugget of The Day Things To Think About: “If you get in the water with business you have to learn how to swim.” “Just because you’re small you don’t have to act small.” “Most people start and they never finish what they start.” Listener Perks: PayPal is offering our listeners $5,000 business loan with NO credit check. item.title: Eps. 85 - The Sweatpants Life
item.description:
How often do you start something and not put 120% into it ? Have you ever experienced having days, weeks, or months where you just weren’t performing at the level that you should be ? Then something happens that just restarts your ignition. In today’s podcast the guys discuss the importance of taking advantage of your life and the opportunities you currently have. ET explains that you shouldn’t wait until something bad happens in your life to start going 120. You should wake up every single day and give 120 to everything you’re doing. Time Stamped Topics: [08:20] - ET & The NBA [10:30] - What problems do you solve ? [29:40] - Humans are lazy [50:22] - Embrace the opportunity of life [1:06:00] - One Gotta Go [1:16:00] - Ask ET [1:23:50] - Nugget of the Day Things To Think About: “Stay in your circle of competence” “What tangible value do you bring ?” “What problems can you solve ?” “What job would you do if you didn’t need a job ?” “If you lick the opportunity in front of you that’s what opens the door to the next one.” Listener Perks: Hello Fresh Meal Kit delivery service is offering our listeners $30 off their first week of service. Use code “SUCCESS30” while checking out to take advantage of this offer. Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. item.content:encoded:
How often do you start something and not put 120% into it ? Have you ever experienced having days, weeks, or months where you just weren’t performing at the level that you should be ? Then something happens that just restarts your ignition. In today’s podcast the guys discuss the importance of taking advantage of your life and the opportunities you currently have. ET explains that you shouldn’t wait until something bad happens in your life to start going 120. You should wake up every single day and give 120 to everything you’re doing.

Time Stamped Topics:

  • [08:20] - ET & The NBA
  • [10:30] - What problems do you solve ?
  • [29:40] - Humans are lazy
  • [50:22] - Embrace the opportunity of life
  • [1:06:00] - One Gotta Go
  • [1:16:00] - Ask ET
  • [1:23:50] - Nugget of the Day

Things To Think About:

“Stay in your circle of competence”

“What tangible value do you bring ?”

“What problems can you solve ?”

“What job would you do if you didn’t need a job ?”

“If you lick the opportunity in front of you that’s what opens the door to the next one.”

Listener Perks:

  • Hello Fresh Meal Kit delivery service is offering our listeners $30 off their first week of service. Use code “SUCCESS30” while checking out to take advantage of this offer.

item.title: Get Your Reps Up
item.description:
In order to go from one level to the next we have to use the tool of repetition. Using repetition will allow you to exercise that skill and although you may be uncomfortable and you might even be miserable, it’s needed to get you to the next level. Find the gap in your gift and practice. Don’t wait until an opportunity comes to practice. Make a decision today to practice and use the tool of repetition to become great within your gift. “I am responsible for taking myself from subpar to average, I am responsible for taking myself from average to great.” Thank you so much for listening to this episode of Tuesday's Power Up episode. If you haven’t done so already, please take a minute and leave a quick rating and review of the show in iTunes . See ET Live: Detroit, Mi August 24 Entrepreneurship Workshop
